      Sort of.  You can withhold your name and/or the amount you contributed from the public, but I will still see your name and contribution amount.  This is necessary for Perks to be fulfilled. After clicking on your Perk, make sure to check the box that says "[x] Don't display my name on the campaign page" (more information).  If you want to remain completely anonymous, you could send me a donation via BitCoin or cash.  See next question.


Are there other ways I can send you funds?
      Sure!  If the campaign has already ended or you don't want to use IndieGoGo for any reason, you can use PayPal, BitCoin, postal mail (cash, money orders, treasure chests full of gold, ect.), or contact me directly to arrange anything else (Vancity transfer, Western Union, etc.).

Back to index ⤴

Receiving Perks


What are Perks?
      Perks are a way to reward you for your financial contribution.  My goal is to make this campaign more than just a fundraiser, I want you to be completely happy that you helped out!  I have tried to come up with some compelling Perks, and I hope you enjoy them.


Are there any additional shipping charges?
      No!  All Perks already include worldwide shipping.

Back to index ⤴

Background information


Where are you from?
      I was born near the village of Port Clements on the island chain of Haida Gwaii (also formerly known as the Queen Charlotte Islands), the ancestral home of the Haida people, located off the north-western coast of British Columbia, Canada.  I moved to Vancouver when I was seven years old, and have since lived in many places around BC.


Is "Raven" your real name?
      Yes!  My parents went with the name because there was an actual raven flying around the meadow outside the log cabin where I was born.  My birth name was Raven Morris, and I have been going by Raven Singularity for the past couple years.  I want to legally change my name, but have been too sick to obtain the required documentation.


What medical conditions are you dealing with?
      My medical condition is complex, with many interrelated issues and symptoms.  I have been formerly diagnosed as having Chronic Rhinosinusitis (sinus infection) and Environmental Sensitivities (ES), but despite this I have been unable to find any public medical help for years on end.  I am no longer strong enough to keep seeking public medical help at this point, so I have turned to private medical help, which has been fast and effective.  My 30 minute private consultation with a sinus expert was more beneficial than the previous 15 years of seeking public medical help!  It was the best $500 I have ever spent.  The sinus expert reviewed my CT scan and did an examination and reported that I have a severely deviated septum (broken nose from early childhood that I didn't know about), major sinus blockage, sinus infection, presence of sticky mucous, sinus inflammation, and other sinus issues (read the medical details on my Facebook).


What is your current living arrangement and financial situation?
      Several months before our daughter was born, Haisla Collins (Malaika's mother) and I had already separated.  A couple months after Malaika's birth, we moved in together as roommates, so that we would both have access to our daughter.  In November 2013 I was cut off Income Assistance because of living with someone that helps care for my daughter.  We were not in a relationship and did not meet the government's criteria for marriage-like/commonlaw, it was strictly because I lived at the same address as someone assisting Malaika.  They would not even allow me to remove Malaika from my file and only receive assistance for myself.  For the next half-year the three of us continued to live together, with me sick and struggling to come up with monthly rent, and not having money to feed myself.  Haisla moved out a month ago, with Malaika.  The house I am renting from was sold shortly after Haisla moved out, and I must be out by the end of August 2014.


Can't you receive Income Assistance if you're living alone now?
      A couple months ago I received the first portion of money from a family land sale, and I am living off the final bit of this right now.  The money is not considered "income", however people are not eligible for Income Assistance if they have any savings.  People on disability assistance are permitted to have savings, but my application for disability was silently denied, despite including a documented diagnosis of Environmental Sensitivities, which is a recognised disability in Canada.  Filing for disability is a complex process, and I am currently far too sick to manage a second application.  I am in the process of filing my taxes in order to receive the final portion of land sale money, which I will use while recovering from my illness (for expenses related to rent, living, moving, medical needs, getting back to work, and paying off any income tax from this campaign).


If you have Environmental Sensitivities, why do you live with a long-haired cat?
      For most of my life I did not react to most things found in nature, including animal dander, trees, flowers, pollen, and even cut grass.  During the last year I have become steadily more sensitive, and now I react strongly to all of these things.  Sitsa is being cared for by someone else the past couple months, as I'm too sick right now.  I hope to recover from surgery, get the air purifiers, and get Sitsa back!


Wouldn't it be cheaper to buy an air conditioner than stay in a hotel?
      Air conditioners usually have poor air filters, or none at all, causing them to put out large amounts of particulate matter.  This burns my throat within minutes and quickly becomes unbearable.  Most hotels have air conditioners with decent air filters that are changed regularly, and I would be able to check this out before renting a room.

Back to index ⤴


Revisiting the cabin on Haida Gwaii where I was born, decades later.



   Left: me and my sister playing on a windy beach with a Tonka truck.
   Right: me and a cat friend outside the cabin.
   



Ways you can help out!
A contribution of even $1 helps a lot — it could help the campaign make it to the front page of IndieGoGo — but you don't need a credit card to help the campaign succeed!

Record a brief video in support of the campaign!
Campaigns succeed or fail based on how involved supporters are.  To that end, it would mean the world to me if you could record a video in support of this campaign – I would love to hear what you have to say!


Do you know me or Malaika and have a brief story to share?
Do you know what it's like living with Environmental Sensitivities or chronic sinus infection?
Have you slipped through the cracks of Canada's public healthcare system?
Anything else you would like to share?
How to share your video ➤

Help promote the campaign
I have made a list below of the most effective ways you can help this campaign, based on how much time you can volunteer!
Never underestimate how much power you have to grow an online campaign when making good use of your time and resources!
How much time can you spare?
1 - 2 minutes

Post a comment or question on this page
Share the campaign link on your Facebook, Google+, Twitter, or other social media
5 - 10 minutes

Send short personal e-mails, texts, or chat messages to the people you know who are most likely to help out!

Send me a friend request on Facebook and Like or Share my messages about the campaign
Write a personal message about the campaign and post it to your Facebook, Google+, Twitter, or other social media
20 - 30 minutes

Record a brief video in support of the campaign

      Post about the campaign to your online communities (e.g. mailing lists, groups, message boards, blogs, private sites, Reddit, Digg)Please don't spam, keep posts relevant to the community!  Many forums have an "off-topic" section where you can post anything you like.  Personal posts are the most effective!

60 - 90 minutes

Pick the five most popular or famous people you know, and personally ask them if they would be willing to send a message out to their contacts about the campaign!
Submit the story to online news sites and blogs

      Contact local media in Metro Vancouver or British Columbia about the campaign (print, radio, TV)Relevant news topics could include: disability, chronic illness, access to healthcare, social injustice, child poverty, access to Income Assistance and Disability, landlord issues; please post a message or contact me directly if you have any questions!

A whole afternoon

Personally tell everybody you know about the campaign — friends, family, people in your groups and clubs, distant relatives, co-workers, roommates, classmates, cellmates, your hair stylist, street mimes!
A longer time

Wow, contact me to coordinate something!

Join the campaign Team
If you know me or Malaika in real life, you can show your support by joining the campaign Team as a "Supporter", which means your name, photo, and Facebook icon will shown up at the bottom of the page.  Please contact me for instructions!

Help pick up some things for me
I don't usually have the energy to leave the house, so it would be greatly appreciated if anybody could pick up any of the items below, and drop them off for me in north Burnaby!
If you contact me before you buy something, I can take it off the list.  I can pay in cash ($20s) or Vancity transfer (if you have an account).


Pharmacy items: Epsom bathing salts, large cloth adhesive bandages, mouth thermometer, tape measure (this kind), nasal irrigation aid (neti-pot), Gaviscon mint flavoured antacid liquid


Roots/herbs: Oregon grape root, goldenseal root, Angelica root, licorice root, pleuisy root, lemongrass root, lemon verbena leaves, lemon balm leaves, mint leaves, euphrasia/eyebright leaves, stevia leaves, elder flower, chamomile flower, Echinacea, yarrow, catnip. (Note: looking for fresh or dried, minimally processed; do not want tinctures, extracts, pills, or oils please)


Spices/nutrition: Himalayan/pink rock salt (whole chunks or ground, no additives), whole nutmeg, whole cloves, green cardamom pods, black cardamom pods, ajwain/carom pods, coriander seeds, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, dried bay leaves, dried curry leaves, dried fenugreek leaves, red chili powder, ground asafetida, ground ginger, ground paprika. (Note: looking for intensely flavoured spices, such as what you find at the Indian shops south of 41st and Fraser; do not want prepackaged)


Appliances/kitchen: Sprouter with bag of alfalfa or other mild sprouting seeds, dehumidifier (confirm price), NutriBullet or MagicBullet blender, juicer (confirm price), cheesecloth, kitchen scale, one or two 2nd-hand coffee grinders with low blades suitable for grinding spices, 6 to 12 regular-mouth 1-litre Mason jars with lids

Bicycle accessories: Blinking red light, large pack of AAA batteries, rear panniers with rack (confirm price first)

Help drive me to appointments/errands
I could use a lift to my appointments and running my errands.  I'm often too sick to take the bus, and taxis are not affordable.  Things like grocery shopping can leave me exhausted for days after.  I would be happy to pay for gas or buy you lunch as thanks!  Please contact me if you can help out.

Help me with moving preparations
The house where I'm staying has been sold, and I need to be moved out by the end of the month (August 2014).  I'm mostly bedridden and could greatly use a hand with finding a new place, packing, cleaning, recycling, garbage disposal, and moving.  If you might be able to help with any of these, please contact me directly!
Back to index ⤴





Web links & campaign Team


Raven's contact info Phone, postal mail, e-mail, web form, etc.

Raven's Facebook page Send me a friend request or message me; campaign updates will be posted here, please Like and Share

Campaign page on Facebook All campaign updates will be posted to this page, please Like and Share

Raven's Twitter feed Not used much yet, follow me and I'll follow you; campaign updates will be posted, please retweet

Raven's YouTube channel Not many videos uploaded yet, but several playlists available; will be adding a lot of content if I get better

Raven's Google+ page Barely used so far; add me to your circles or message me

Raven's personal web site Web site unfinished due to illness, it might be fixed one day

H.E.L.P. web site A web site I made a couple years ago about some of my projects, but have been too sick to update it further

The Collective Earth Facebook page with postings about humans working together; have been too sick to post much, but if I get better I will be posting hundreds of links
Back to index ⤴

story:
Elimar's basic HIV medicines cost $900 a month. $5 can buy school supplies and food for her and the kids.

Elimar, 32 and mother of two, has been living with HIV for 15 years. She learned that she contracted the virus while pregnant with her first born, Jonatas. Fearful that she was not long for this world, and knowing that mother-to-fetus HIV transmission is preventable, Elimar's doctor advised that she and her husband give Jonatas (14) a sibling, and so they did (Elizabeth, 11). They will have each other when their parents are no longer with us.    

A native of Brazil, Elimar relocated her family to the San Francisco Bay Area, U.S.A. in 2003 seeking broader HIV treatment options. The family lived "comfortably" on the wages of a hair dresser and housekeeper for many years until the HIV started taking its toll and the side effects of the numerous medications started spiraling out of control. Elimar has suffered a whole host of costly, devastating, and in some cases undiagnosable and untreatable medical issues, which will remain unnamed to respect Elimar's privacy.

In the last year, various illnesses have kept Elimar from working more than they have in the past. Yet working perpetuates her illnesses, which expose her to many chemicals (as a housekeeper and hairdresser), and require rest and low stress. It's an endless cycle of needing money to secure the basics and afford critical medications - many of which MediCal does not cover - but being too sick to work and work likely making her sicker. 

I set the goal at $10,000. Why? Her basic HIV medicines cost $900 a month. So if everything goes "right," and she has no side effects or other illnesses, $10,000 buys her 11 months of medication. However, she currently has $3,000 worth of bills - a combination of medication she needs for HIV and a liver complication and household bills.

Elimar truly does what I and others can only imagine - manage her illnesses and her household day in and day out no matter how terrible she feels. She has never sought a hand out and never complains, despite that she has had to choose between the basics and medicine more often than she should. She's doing that now, which is what inspired me to finally launch this campaign. Just recently, Elimar decided not to take her medicines for months because she needs the money to live. No one should have to do that.

Truly, any support she receives from this campaign will be well deserved, put to good use, ease suffering, and give her family a chance  at health, happiness, and prosperity together. The beauty of crowd funding is every dollar counts. $5 will make a difference! If you can't help financially, please share this story with others who may be able to. 

https://twitter.com/helpelimar

(Please note that some details about Elimar's life have been omitted to respect her and other family members' privacy.)

story: THIS IS NOT COSMETIC, IT IS FUNCTIONAL!  I am desperate and really need help.  I am severely disabled (with ataxia, among other things), due to my cerebellum shrinking, and Medicare only covers extraction and dentures (dentures are impossible to manage with Ataxia).  So, I took responsibility and got an individual dental policy through Delta Dental, at the cost of $90.39 a month.  However, they require a $500.00 once in a life time payment that I must have by the end of August for capping an $890.00 root canal (which I had to have, after a tooth broke) I paid for, out-of-pocket (which was extremely difficult), in January.  Luckily, there was no pain involved!

story:
My best friend, Summer got breast cancer four years ago. She is 39 years old and has a young son. She had surgery, chemo and then reconstructive surgery. Last year, she got breast cancer for the second time and had to go through the entire process again. She is going to be getting reconstructive surgery in September. The original  Indie  Go Go campaign was to help her pay to get areola tattoos done after she has reconstructive surgery. 

The tattoos fundraising goal was met, thanks to extremely generous donors!  Now, I am raising money to help Summer pay off medical bills from multiple  surgeries and treatments. 

Any help is greatly appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story: In the devastated country of Haiti, we're showing them that there's hope. We're a small church in Florida making the DIFFERENCE.We recently purchased an ambulance to send it to Haiti to serve as a mobile dental/medical unit for the poor. We need money to help us send our ambulance to Haiti as well as creating a water well to provide clean drinking water. With your HELP lives will be changed and people will have hope. Will you help us? Children's are going to sleep with no water to drink and in pain for not having access to medical and dental, but with your generosity we can change that! Help us!!! 100% of the money raised will go straight to this project. You're welcome to visit us or call anytime. Let's help our brothers and sisters in Haiti, we all needed someone to help us one day in our lives right? Now is your time to help!!! Any amount is very welcome. If you can't help us financially, would you pray for us ?Thank you and God Bless!!!

story:
Why a new hip?

Loren is a dear friend that is ready for a new hip!  She has purchased health insurance, found a surgeon, has scheduled the procedure, but now needs to pay a hefty deposit before she can go forward with the surgery.  And time is limited!

Loren is a spark plug of a woman who does for others - cares for others - in an amazing way! As a Licensed Massage Therapist, Loren's work is centered around others, and her passion for helping people is inspirational.  Loren is a person who really knows how to live a full and interesting life, but now she needs our help.  

Have you heard of pay it forward?  It's more than a movie.  It's Loren's life in a nutshell.  Loren's hope is she can pay the deposit for this surgery, and that you trust her to pay your generosity forward.  I pray that you have something to pay forward and that you will help Loren with this life improving surgery.  

Without the new hip, Loren is limited to what she can do and how long she can work.  So not only is this to improve her quality of life and remove the chronic pain, it will allow her to work and to continue to help others.  That is what Loren is about - helping others.  Please help a friend in need and know that your generous contribution will be paid forward with spark plug gusto!

If you can't help financially, please help by promoting this campaign to get the word out!  Your prayers are so appreciated and remember to share the love!

story:
Do you find our current health care system lacking or incomplete? Have you ever wondered how things could be different, especially for those who are struggling just to make ends meet? Are you inspired by the idea of health care as a holistic, community endeavor? If you’ve answered yes to these questions, then we invite you to join us on our journey to develop our skills, so we can help bring healing and health justice to others.

Our vision

Mary and Nathan dream of developing a community based, wellness center that operates on the principle of whole person health (body, mind, and spirit), and primarily serves individuals and communities that experience social and/or economic barriers under the current system. We aim to create an environment that in, and of itself, fosters wellbeing and healing. Our desire is to uphold traditional medicines and wisdom, while also exploring ways elements of modern, science based medicine can provide additional support. We also seek to create a model that breaks down the traditional top-down hierarchy between health care practitioners and patients, and which also utilizes the arts (writing, photography, painting, etc.) and community building (amongst patients and beyond immediate patients) as key components of healing. In addition, we see the center as a potential hub for health care activism, both in terms of advocating for needed reforms to the current mainstream health care system, as well as providing models for systemic change and transformation.

Our Plan

Mary and Nathan are both in a period of refining the skills we have, and developing additional skills needed to birth the vision. Nathan is in the process of learning the art of leading meditation and classes exploring the wisdom of the Zen tradition. He also is developing an herbal medicine business and practice, and plans on undergoing additional herbalist training in the coming years to deepen his understanding of the plants, and expand his ability to utilize their healing capacities. Mary is in the process of strengthening her clinical skills in a health care setting, and also is exploring how a clinic operates and functions under the current system. She plans on returning to school in the coming year or two to get a Masters in Nurse Practitioner degree, and following that, a Doctorate in Naturopathic Medicine.

What we need help with now

In addition to our longer term learning plans, Mary and Nathan intend to attend conferences and workshops that target specific areas of growth and development. The Buddhist Peace Fellowship’s upcoming National Conference at the end of August is one such event. We see the conference as an opportunity for us to do the following:

explore and practice applying spiritual wisdom to service and activist work,

network with others on similar paths,

and share our vision with folks from across the U.S.

In addition, Nathan will be co-leading a yoga, movement and meditation session at the conference with Oakland based Buddhist teacher Mushim Patricia Ikeda. So any financial gift to this campaign will also support the gift of this class to the approximately 120 people that will be in attendance at the conference.

Our Financial Goal

Our goal is $1,000 for this campaign, which will cover our round trip airfare and car rental costs. If we receive gifts beyond the target goal, they will initially go towards lodging, and to offset the conference fees we already paid.

Beyond immediate expenses for the Conference, any additional gifts will allow us to start shifting more of our financial resources towards the next steps in our long term plan.

The campaign has multiple gift levels listed, but we invite you to give at whatever level you can. Every donation helps!

Other ways you can help with the campaign

In addition to financial contributions, we need help spreading the word about the campaign. If you know either of us, or both of us, offering personalized appeals to your circle of friends and family would be greatly appreciated. We intend to give periodic updates during the campaign, so sharing those updates in your circles also would support us.

Beyond our campaign, we’d love it if interested supporters also spread the word about the good work of the Buddhist Peace Fellowship. Their website is filled with thoughtful and compelling writing from a diverse group of authors, including some of Nathan’s writing. In addition, the Fellowship is developing programs like this conference to support activists, peace-workers, and people in service who seek to integrate their spiritual practice into the work they do in the world. 

Learn More

Nathan recently gave a talk at his Zen community about health and illness, birth and death, where he explored the relationship between holistic health and spiritual practices. Included is a short meditation reflecting on how we respond to commonplace illnesses and pain in our daily lives, as well as conversation about the intersection of personal health with social conditions. You can download the talk here.

Thank You

Thank you for taking the time to learn more about our vision, and for supporting us take a step along the path. Please check out the photos and links we have included to learn more about us, what we do in the world, and our passions.

mind, and spirit), and primarily serves individuals and communities that
experience social and/or economic barriers under the current system. We aim to
create an environment that in, and of itself, fosters wellbeing and healing. Our
desire is to uphold traditional medicines and wisdom, while also exploring ways
elements of modern, science based medicine can provide additional support. We
also seek to create a model that breaks down the traditional top-down hierarchy
between health care practitioners and patients, and which also utilizes the
arts (writing, photography, painting, etc.) and community building (amongst
patients and beyond immediate patients) as key components of healing. In
addition, we see the center as a potential hub for health care activism, both
in terms of advocating for needed reforms to the current mainstream health care
system, as well as providing models for systemic change and transformation. 
Our Plan
Mary and Nathan are both in a period of refining the skills we have, and developing additional skills needed to birth the vision. Nathan
is in the process of learning the art of leading meditation and classes exploring
the wisdom of the Zen tradition. He also is developing an herbal medicine business and practice, and plans on undergoing additional herbalist training in the coming
years to deepen his understanding of the plants, and expand his ability to
utilize their healing capacities. Mary is in the process of strengthening her clinical skills in a health care setting, and also is exploring how a clinic operates and functions
under the current system. She plans on returning to school in the coming year
or two to get a Masters in Nurse Practitioner degree, and following that, a
Doctorate in Naturopathic Medicine. 
What we need help with now
In addition to our longer term learning plans, Mary and
Nathan intend to attend conferences and workshops that target specific areas of growth
and development. The Buddhist Peace Fellowship’s upcoming National Conference at
the end of August is one such event. We see the conference as an opportunity
for us to do the following: explore and practice applying spiritual wisdom to
service and activist work, network with others on similar paths, and share
our vision with folks from across the U.S. In addition, Nathan will be
co-leading a yoga, movement and meditation session at the conference with
Oakland based Buddhist teacher Mushim Patricia Ikeda. So any financial gift to
this campaign will also support the gift of this class to the approximately 120 people that will be in attendance
at the conference. 
Our Financial Goal
Our goal is $1,000 for this campaign, which will cover our round
trip airfare and car rental costs. If we receive gifts beyond the
target goal, they will initially go towards lodging, and to offset the conference fees we
already paid. Beyond immediate expenses for the Conference, any additional gifts will allow us to start shifting more of our financial resources towards the next steps in our long term plan. The campaign has multiple gift levels listed, but we invite you to give at whatever level you can. Every donation helps! 
Other ways you can help with the campaign 
In addition to financial contributions, we need help spreading
the word about the campaign. If you know either of us, or both of us, offering
personalized appeals to your circle of friends and family would be greatly
appreciated. We intend to give periodic updates during the campaign, so sharing
those updates in your circles also would support us. 
Beyond our campaign, we’d love it if interested supporters
also spread the word about the good work of the Buddhist Peace Fellowship.
Their website is filled with thoughtful and compelling writing from a diverse
group of authors, including some of Nathan’s writing. In addition, the
Fellowship is developing programs like this conference to support activists,
peace-workers, and people in service who seek to integrate their spiritual
practice into the work they do in the world. Learn MoreNathan recently gave a talk at his Zen community about health and illness, birth and death, where he explored the relationship between holistic health and spiritual practices. Included is a short meditation reflecting on how we respond to commonplace illnesses and pain in our daily lives, as well as conversation about the intersection of personal health with social conditions. You can download the talk here.Thank YouThank you for taking the time to learn more about our vision, and for supporting us take a step along the path. Please check out the photos and links we have included to learn more about us, what we do in the world, and our passions.

story:
Helping With Shane Elliott's Surgery cost

I have Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber (KTW) syndrome. KTW is a blood vessel and lymphatic overgrowth disorder that caused me to lost my leg.  I've been undergoing surgeries through out my entire life and and coming near the end of my journey and medical struggles. At the end of July on the 31st I'm getting what may be the last or second to last debulking surgery to help me with my disease.

What We Need & What You Get

The reason why i'm making this campaign is because I can't afford to do this completely on my own and out of pocket this year.  I've had these surgeries in the past and have been able to fund it all on my own.  This year I've had some unexpected problems including losing my disability checks and car breaking down.  I live alone, work 40+ hours a week, and am a full time student still at SELU.  With all of these challenges I just can't pull off the expenses this year.  My mother and father are able to pay for my plane tickets but I may not be able to handle the rest of the expenses.  

Here is a break down of how much money I need and what I need them for and how the money will be used.

$313 is still owed to one of the specialist from last year that I never received the bill from.

$500-625 will be my hotel cost for the medical purpose hotel that is across the street from the St. Roosevelt hospital in Manhattan.

$800-900 will be in left over cost because my medicare/medicaid doesn't cover all of the cost, some parts medicaid doesn't cover at all and medicare only does about %80 of the total cost. 

$50-125 in cab fees in NYC cost between the airport, hotel, and pharmacy

$50 in food cost while being there for 5 days.

The Impact

Before my first surgery with Dr. Levitin in NYC I could barely walk and was coming close to being kicked out of college.  Now I'm nearing the end of my college career with only 7 classes left and can even run and swim again.  With continued treatment I will be able to live a more normal life.

What will happen with excess and left over money?

I plan to donate any extra money to the KT foundation for other persons with this disease.  I even plan to document every penny that I spend in NYC to show all the people that help me exactly what their money goes to and so that everyone can be assured that the exact total of left over funds will be donated to charity.

story:
Terri O’Connell gets back on track!

To Make Sports History

With a Fan Based, Grass Roots - National Trifecta Effort & You Too Can Come Along on the 200 Miles per Hour Ride

Win a Free Trip  to Hollywood! Be in a Documentary or have a cameo in the up coming feature film "Dangerous Curves" based on her top selling memoir "Dangerous Curves"!

Talladega, Pocono & Michigan!

Gearing Up To Drive Out Bullying, Domestic Violence, Sexual Abuse & Sexual Assault!

Be a Drafting Partner with Terri O’ and her Team!

It’s Going to be Dynamic, Compelling, Historic, Kick Ass … Trailblazing!

Attend a VIP Purple Carpet Celebrity, Fan & Media Filled Charity Launch Event!

Live Web Podcast of the VIP Launch event Exclusive to our partners!

Your Name on the Race Car!

We will design a cutting full color wrap for the car and every partner’s name, or name & photo, or company logo will be specifically placed on the car!


Terri O’Connell

Author, Model, Artist, Engineer, Pro Racer, National Champion,  

                               TV Personality, Trailblazer!

527 Wins . 307 Fast Times . 52 New Track Records

These accomplishments were all earned on a National level competing in Karts, Midgets, Modifieds, 410 Sprint Cars, Late Models and she even has a stint in NASCAR’s premier Series Sprint Cup!

O’Connell has been tagged as the Female “Rocky” by Grumpy Old Men producers … her compelling memoir Dangerous Curves, was labeled “the new bench mark for Southern Autobiographies” by a NYT’s bestselling author, and she was called a “Renaissance Woman” by iconic actress Candice Bergin during an interview on her Oxygen talk show!

Plus, a top race promoter (Shand Tillman)  at one of the Americas premier speedways, who has seen the best drivers in America compete, boldly and emphatically stated that “Terri O’ is one of the top five racers I have ever seen race”, during a compelling 20/20 interview focused on Terri!



Now it’s time for Terri to re - up the game and get back on track at Americas premier Super Speedways with her incredible Get’n back Trifecta Race package with lots of perks and fan center opportunities!

Partner with Terri O’ & Bob Schacht

@ These 3 Dynamic Events

Your exciting opportunity to play a part in these Premier sporting events as a team member and VIP!

Three top Television events in the ARCA REMAX Racing Series

Live on Fox Sports 1

Talladega – May 3rd, 2014
Pocono – June 7th, 2014
Michigan – June 13th, 2014


   

  


Budget … $325K


Beginning Fund Date … January 20th
End Fund Date … March 5th  


All funding generated here will be applied to race team budget for these three historic events and the filming of a behind a scenes documentary surrounding these top flight events.

 … Note …

(If we only raise $150K we will provide these efforts for Talladega – one event)

(If we raise more than our total budget we will apply these funds toward other racing events in ARCA and the NASCAR Nationwide Series, and promoting the Purple Helmet Initiative)



 

Transcending Sports!

A High Profile International Pop Culture and Fan Media Event!


The Theme of this effort is …


Driving Out Bullying, Domestic Violence, Sexual Assault & Abuse!

Play a part in this dynamic sports and philanthropic media event as a VIP Partner… and the opportunity to make a difference in others lives!


You too, can appear in a Documentary & PSA built around this effort ... plus have the opportunity to appear as a cameo in the movie "Dangerous Curves" based on Terri O's top selling memoir "Dangerous Curves!

"Dangerous Curves is the new bench mark for Southern autobiographies over Paula Deen and Dolly Pardon!"
--Patricia Nell Warren, New York Times best Selling Author


Terri O Has Done the Work, She Has the Talent, Now …

She has done the work, re honed her national championship skills, took on the bad boys clawing her way back to the top of the sport, and now she is ready to get back on the Super Speedways. She has the team, the crew, the PR team, THE SUPPORT OF THE BIGGEST SANCTIONING BODIES IN STOCK CAR RACING, thousands of fans from around the world and the talent to get the job done. 

Now, Terri O’ and her team is getting back to super speedway racing, and we are inviting everyone to come along on this incredible road back to the top levels of Stock car Racing. It’s going to be fun, dynamic, fast and compelling!


Be Terri O’s Drafting Partner at Talladega!

Perks, Incentives, Gift Bags, Be on TV!

By supporting this effort, by becoming a partner with Terri O’Connell and her Rev X / Bob Schacht Racing Team, you’re not only supporting a compelling sports and pop culture effort, you have the opportunity to receive some amazing gifts and perks in return. Perks like amazing posters, framed prints, cool shirts, Hoodies, jackets and hats exclusively designed by Terri O’ along with the opportunity to win trips to the events to be Terri and her teams special VIP guest. Plus many more added incentives including VIP invitations to the Purple Carpet VIP and Celebrity filled launch for this historic effort, and the opportunity to appear with Terri O’ on TV as she does her many interviews leading up to and during the running of these exciting events.

Be Terri O’s Drafting Partner to Drive Out Bullying, Domestic Violence & Sexual Assault at Talladega!

Your Name & Face on the Car!

All supporters will get their name and face on the car located on the rear quarter panels and back trunk lid!

(Name Size ¾” X 1”) (Face size: 1”x1”)

Everyone will be able to view their name on the car via our web site plus down load a photo of the car, driver and team directly from the site!

The Plan

  Generate / Develop / Launch / Awareness 

You’re Our Partner; Let’s do This Together, Let’s Make a Difference!

Key: Developing marketing and branding partnerships between corporate, individuals and media partners surrounding this historic endeavor encompassing sports, philanthropic & entertainment that transcends into exciting  mainstream pop culture media events


Branding Exposure

This effort will generate unique and historical branding exposure past the actual event, what Terri O’ and the team do on the track is important, however the key is to drive an unprecedented marketing campaign transcending the track by driving into the international pop culture, music and the entertainment audiences to support this inspiring effort! Rev X, Terri O’Connell, Carter Management and Bob Schacht Racing have developed an exciting marketing program that directly interacts with fans and the media ensuring compelling personal profiles surrounding the team, and our committed partnerships supporting the courageous effort with video profiles - national personal appearances by the team as a collective group and individually bringing awareness to bullying, domestic violence, sexual assault on a global scale!

Behind the Scenes Documentary

In addition, we are developing  a revealing behind the scenes documentary alongside five, ten and fifteen minute vignettes to post on partners web sites, the teams web sites, blogs and YouTube surrounding the project, about the driver, team, support partners, and all the compelling dynamics for putting this historic effort in place! All investment partners will receive a free copy of all these video efforts. This concept will also be offered to exclusive media partners supporting this effort drawing millions of views throughout their social and web based media. The team will be offered to specific high profile media partner as a daily follow along the week of the race event and all the promotional appearances by the team including the VIP and Celeb Gala launch event in Los Angeles!

You’re our partner in getting the message out surrounding this great cause and effort … come hang out with us at these great events.

Our marketing and Public Relations team is developing  partnerships with all media ... Talk Shows, Networks, News Media (local, regional, National, international) and our supporters and partners will have full access to all media interviews and media events and even have the opportunity to interact and appear in these media events!

Jam Session in the Grove

(Carter Management Presents / TBA)

Free Music in the grove hanging with Terri O’

 

Be on TV with Terri O’


Our Marketing and PR team are currently positioning this effort with several main stream and pop culture media outlets, and you can come along for the ride as Terri’s personal guest while she does her interviews!

(Example Potential Shows)  

The View / Elllen / The Talk / Kelly & Michael / Windy Williams / ET

 

  



National Purple Carpet Media Launch

You can be there too …

Launching this effort with a compelling and exciting Rev X – Carter Management National Purple Carpet media, VIP, celeb gala and Purple Helmet Initiative fund raiser at a top entertainment venue in Los Angelis!

Get Your Own Night Out on the Town with Terri O…

Terri O’Connell & Rev X night out in LA …  Get your very own all expenses paid night out on the Town in LA with Terri O’ with shopping, dining, clubbing and attend the Ellen Show and more!

Receive Terri O’s Cutting Edge, Iconic Art Work & Posters!


Receive one of Terri O’ Cool Purple Helmet T Shirts!






Receive Cool Decals Supporting This Amazing Effort!




How to Partner With Our Team & Efforts!


1)  Bronze Package ………….. $5.00

2)  Silver Package …………….. $25.00

3)  Gold Package ………………. $50.00

4)  Premier Package …………. $100.00

5)  Platinum Package ……….. $250.00

6)  VIP Executive Package ... $500.00

7)  VIP Executive Purple Helmet Package … $1000.00 & above

8) Purple Helmet Initiative Bonus Sweepstakes package … ($5,000.00)

9)  Exclusive Corporate  Elite Package … $10,000.00 & Above 

10)  Corporate VIP Primary Package … ($50,000.00 & above )

 

Note: Defined Budget Needs

Our budget - expenses to do these events (plus four test – two at Talladega, One at Pocono, & one at Michigan) and team-driver promotions include paying crew and team members salaries, race engine rentals, tires, fuel for race car and team race haulers, travel, hotel, entry fees, promotional materials and potentially unexpected added cost to run the car and team at these (3) premier events … plus production cost for the behind the scenes documentary. All monies raised through this indiegogo project will be applied to these specific efforts.


Listed below is a more comprehensive look at our amazing perks and incentive packages!


Perks Baby!


Defined Perks, Prizes & Incentives

1)  Bronze Packages receives ($5.00) Personal Phone Call from Terri O to thank you for supporting this effort plus a free down load of her memoir Dangerous Curves & Terri O photo and poster as well as bi monthly news letter surrounding this effort and all of Terri O’s 2014 racing endeavors. Plus your name and located on the race car during these events! (Everyone will be able to download a photo of your name on the car via the official goterriogo.com website & your name will appear on the documentary as a contributor to this project) (Your name will appear as a ¾” X 1”)

2)  Silver Package ($25.00) receives all of the Bronze Package perks and opportunities to win incentives plus a 25% off discount voucher on all Dangerous Curves Society Art & Apparel, free access to the behind the scenes pod cast during testing and training at these race events, and along with your name on the car, your face will appear as well (1’’ X 1’’ Photo)!

3)  Gold Packages ($50) receives both the Bronze and Silver packages and opportunities to win incentives plus a free DVD of the Behind the scenes Documentary surrounding this amazing effort including the concert preformed by a top musical act or group, and the opportunity to win a job on the team for one race weekend (all expenses paid), and Pit Road (Hot Passes for two people) for one of the three events … plus exclusive designed Purple Helmet Initiative high quality Team Decal!

4)  Premier Packages ($100.00) receives all of the Bronze, Silver and Gold packages and opportunities to win incentives plus the opportunity to appear in the behind the scenes documentary surrounding these events, one exclusively design Terri O’, Dangerous Curves – Purple helmet Initiative T – Shirt and the opportunity to win one of Terri O’s signature Purple Racing helmets through a charity drawing … one free Terri O’ Poster of your choice (Drafting U, Terri O Bolder, Boldest, Color me Gone, Stock Car – 2 Stocks racing)

5)  Platinum Packages ($250.00) receives all of the perks and incentives listed in the Bronze, Silver, Gold and Premier packages and opportunities to win incentives plus, two garage access passes, your picture taken with Terri O’ and Richard petty Look- a- like Charles West, The opportunity to win one of Terri O’s driving uniforms, concert VIP passes at one of Carter Managements concerts (R&B – Hip Hop – Rock – Country), plus the opportunity to win an all expenses paid weekend at one of the three events … and your choice of two posters) plus a newly revised edition (autograph copy) glossy paper back of Terri O’s memoir Dangerous Curves. In addition you will receive an exclusive deigned high quality decal of  Terri O’s iconic Color Me Gone design!

6)  VIP Executive Package ($500.00) receives all of the perks and prizes listed in the Bronze, Silver, Gold, Premier and Platinum packages and opportunities to win incentives plus a larger photo of yourself and name on the race car (1.5” X 1.5”), a ride around the Speedway with Terri O’ at one of the events, the opportunity to appear on Television with Terri O during one of her TV interviews, an official team hat, and your choice of  two posters and a canvas print of her exclusive Color Me Gone art!

7)  VIP Executive Purple Helmet Package ($1,000.00) receives all of the perks and prizes and opportunities to win incentives in the Bronze, Silver, Gold, Premier, Platinum and VIP packages plus one hospitality VIP package that include VIP Hospitality Speedway access during the race Weekend, one team Hoodie printed with exclusive Terri O art and exclusive VIP Executive team dinner with Terri O and team at official race team motorcoach and compound. Plus the opportunity to win a new I Pad!

8) Purple Helmet Sweepstakes Bonus Package … ($5,000.00) This bonus package gives everyone the chance who supports this perk to win perks listed in all other perks plus a small role in the upcoming feature film Dangerous Curves based on Terri O’s top selling memoir Dangerous Curves … plus a full day at the track with Terri O’ and her team teaching you to drive a NASCAR Nationwide Stock Car (Langley Speedway, Hampton Virginia!

9)  Exclusive Corporate Elite Package ($10,000.00 & above) receives all of the perks and prizes and opportunities to win incentives in the Bronze, Silver, Gold, Premier, Platinum, VIP Executive and VIP Executive Purple Helmet packages plus your company’s logo on the race car, driver and team uniforms and the opportunity to win for one race weekend the use of a luxury motorcoach parked right alongside Terri O and her entourage … and producer credit on the Documentary! Plus one high quality tailored race jacket designed by Terri O’ and made to fit by Hinchman Racing Uniforms and producer credit on the behind the scenes documentary centered on this amazing effort.

10)  Royal Corporate VIP Primary Package … ($50,000.00 & above ) receives all of the perks and prizes and opportunities to win incentives in the Bronze, Silver, Gold, Premier, Platinum, VIP Executive, VIP Executive Purple Helmet  and Exclusive Corporate Elite packages! Plus the guaranteed use of a 38” luxury motorcoach  for one of the race events, EXCLUSIVE  one on one diner with Terri O’ and a celeb mystery guest cooked by NASCAR Chef James Lupo. Your company brand posted on our web sites and all social media for one year. The logo and brand of your choice will play as the primary partnership positioning on race car, driver team uniforms guaranteed for at least one of the three events to be run! And the opportunity to win an all expense paid two nights, three day trip to Beverly Hill, Ca with accommodations at the Beverly Hilton, while paling around with Terri O’ to many LA hotspots, shopping, top restaurants and TV show Tapings.

                       ... NOTE ...

All perks will available by March 10th or sooner however, some of the bigger perks will only be available on the race dates them selves or during the Purple Helmet VIP launch event date (TBA) or after the race events (IE; driving suit, race helmet etc...) or during the shooting of the feature film (TBA)


You have the opportunity to have luxury weekend at the race in a motorcoach just like this one!

 

Hospitality and VIP!

  

  

Get on board this great effort and help Terri O' drive out Bullying, Domestic Violence, Sexual Assault & Sexual Abuse!


Check out all the cool info about Terri O'Connell (Driving Records, Endorsements, Book Excerpts, Trivia, Reviews, Videos, Art, Pics and much more) on her amazing web sites goterriogo.com and purple-helmet.org ... now buckle up and lets get this effort started!




copyright 2014 O-ter International / Pitwall Productions

story:
About the Project

In a world filled with potential ways to stray from health, we find it exceptionally important to remind youths about medical issues that can affect them and the people they love.  iHealthSS Inc. is a new, start-up non-profit that aims to get youths in Canada to think critically about the world around them and to raise awareness of various relevant medical topics.  In the past, we've experimented with projects on the link between skin cancer and tanning, and recently have added mental health to our repertoire.  We want to take this concept to the next level, and we need your help to do it.  

About the Founder

My name is Noel Garber, and I founded the concept of iHealthSS back in 2011 in my last year of high school after a very positive experience at a local mini-medical school program for high-achieving students.  Right now, I'm in my second year of the Bachelor of Health Sciences (Honours) program at McMaster University, and I'm hoping to attend medical school after I complete my degree.  I'll continue to be involved with iHealthSS Inc. throughout my education and beyond.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $1,500 to start up our operations, but our expenses are continuous, so all donations are highly appreciated.  Much of that will be directed towards promotional materials, which come in two forms - print materials, which become very expensive very quickly, but are somewhat static, and product-based materials.  For an example of the latter, for our mental health outreach program, we want to purchase brain-shaped stress balls with our name on them to distribute to people who listen to what we have to say - an attractor, so to speak.  

Also, our other main cost is computing products.  We already have touch screens and computers, but still require a projector so as to be entirely self-sufficient.  

The Impact

$1,500 may not seem like much money, but that's the beauty of what we do - the vast majority of our work is done by volunteers, so we have no payroll costs, and all we need is some capital to start with so that we can amp up our ideas to become a reality.  So what is the impact?  Helping the youths of today, the people of the future, be as healthy as they can be so that they can accomplish great things in the future.

story:
Hi Everybody, 

we are two creative and passionate venturesome guys –Gabor Ferenczy and Csaba Enyedi from Budapest, Hungary- who are crazy and determined enough to entirely reimagine a popular leisure time activity on lakes, the water biking.

Gabor has a 10 year advertising background as a copywriter and Csaba has an energetics, marketing and sales background. 

Gabor came up one sunny day with an idea of setting up a waterbike race around Hungary’s biggest lake, Balaton. 

But recently there are waterbikes mostly with dolphin and swan shapes which are not the most suitable ones for this.

So we teamed up to combine our talents and create something really new. Both of us has a lifelong devotion towards water and to walk the red brick road instead of the good old yellow one.

Project Hydrocumbent

We would like to finish a race water bike that’s breathtaking both in design and drive. We named it the ’Hydrocumbent’ built from the words water and the recumbent bike.

The race water bike takes a well-known but till now technically stagnating leisure time activity to a new level. With our model everyone –from the age of 9 to 99- can spend more time on water, organize comfy excursions, or push the pedal to the max, by reaching an average 15-18 km/h with bare calves.

Why we need you

We have a race water bike prototype planned with the students of the Budapest University of Technology and Economics and developed with a Hungarian ship manufacturer.

Till this moment we injected only private funds into this project and with our passion for this whole initiative and despite all hardships we managed to have this beautiful prototype designed and developed. 

But as most trailblazers we also stepped onto unbeaten track and need financial encouragement to finally succeed.

With your generous help we will be able to get from the prototype to a mass production model, test it and and step into the spotlight be it either international water sports exhibitions or lakeside and beach rentals.

Your generosity our gratitude

As we already raised curiosity within and beyond our borders that’s why we have to get from B to C. in completing our dream.

We calculated to collect 40 000 Euros to be able to finalize a mass production model build another one and take them to a wider audience in order to spread the bike.

How will this amount be spent? What are the milestones? 

First we have to put our experiences and learnings gained through the prototype testing into practice by finalizing the technical details of the mass production model.

Then we finalize the mass production model and manufacture another model to be able to present them together everywhere.

If we are ready with that we will have to contact and negotiate with future investors, customers in Hungary and foreign countries, as far as possible appearing at international exhibitions, water sport shows in Europe, Asia and the United States depending on costs.

When we reach our financial goal we will launch a marketing campaign by finalizing our website, producing sales materials and advertising the project first online.

Your unique perks with which we will express our gratitude for believing in our project will range from your personal signature printed on the first mass production model, or named after you to inviting you to Hungary for a free ride on one of the race water bike or discount from the selling-price. 

If we reach our goal and succeed in collecting the desired amount of money we will accomplish these milestones and involve you in the whole process because you made it possible!

The bright future

We believe that a new type of fun and competitive water sport can reach everybody who loves and cares for nature, who likes biking on the waves as well and who’s a fan of avant-garde design and speed gained by human power.

We believe that the Hydrocumbent race water bike will entertain as many people as possible who choose active relaxation at lakes and seashores all around the globe. The race track is given it’s up to us how we race on it.

If there’s no money but social capital

You can also jump in to push the pedal together! You can also help us reaching our goal by spreading the word and generate hype around the race water bike to involve girls and guys who believe in this idea as well.

Feel free to use Indiegogo’s share tools!


Thanks very much for your attention!

story:
Raising money to purchase a Pull Cart for my dog, Olaf.

Hello, my name is Michael Faughn and I live in Nampa, Idaho, just outside Boise. I am 51 years old and have spent most of my life working with and training dogs as well as desiging and installing landscapes. Three years ago I was hurt on the job. The injuries were to both arms and required four surgeries. The surgeries were un-successful. I have seen 9 doctors in two different states. The diagnosis is always the same, my tendons in my elbows are deteriorating, sveral nerves are twisted and the main nerve, ulnar nerve, is pinched. I am in constant pain and have lost about 65% use of both my arms. Specialist have told me if I have one more surgery on my arms, there is an 80% chance I will loose complete use of them. I can no longer play golf, play the piano, play softball, draw, type for long periods of time, lift anything over 5lbs, no repetitive gripping or movement, no power gripping such as using a hammer, drill, holding a stearing wheel, or shopping cart. If I disregard the doctor's orders and do these things, the pain is overwhelming.

I live alone in a 5th wheel trailer  due to the fact that I lost my house when I was unable to return to work and was put on Social Security Disability. I could no longer afford the house payments, nor the utilities. I ownded my home for 11 years. I worked 12 hours days, 7 days a week and now nothing. I have an issue with pushing a shopping cart or carrying those small baskets when I am shopping. Normally I have to ask someone to go with me, which isn't always easy to do. I have a certified service dog. His name is Olaf, he is a Rotty. He is my best friend, he carries stuff for me in backpacks made for him. However, they only carry a small amount. Being able to use a cart such as the one in the photo would make it easier for Olaf as well as me. I could be more independant and free to go when I please.

Olaf has been trained to pull a cart, I just cannot afford one on my Social Security Disability income. Most of my money is spent on rent, food and utilities. There is never enough to make it to the end of the month as it is.

The cart shown can range in price from $300 to $650, depending on the size. The one that will work with my needs as well as Olaf, is right around $500. All the money I raise here will go for the purchase of the cart. Even if I am not able to reach my goal of $500, what is raised will be set aside and put towards the cart. The halter that is needed to pull the cart is already being donated to me by Fidogear. They are custom building Olaf a halter.

I have always been independent and refused to ask for help. If I couldn't do it for myslef, by myself, then I didn't need it. Getting hurt has helped me learn to be humble and ask for help. I have tried asking the makers of these carts if they would donate one and the response is always the same, their profit margines are too small to afford them the ability to donante one. I understand, it is hard for all of us.

The only thing I can offer in return for your donation is having your name or company's name painted on the side of the cart, such as "This Cart Made Availalbe by the Donations from;"


I know that not everyone can donate cash and I can appriciate that. If you can help me with spreading the word, that would be great. You can use the Indiegogo share feature

I can provide copies of the specialists reports to anyone needing them.
 
Thank you for taking the time to read this. I hope you have a fantastic day.

story:
Jul Bujh is a snap on retrofit device that improves the efficiency of millions of legacy water heaters across the globe, making them eco-friendly


Installation videos will be available for download through our web site close to shipment date of the product.

The Apps will be available for download from respective official App stores for iPhone and Android platforms at the time of product shipment.


All Jul Bujh devices in all packages can be shipped to different addresses all over the world. All devices can also be donated for install at a not for profit facility. We can install on your behalf at a location of your choice in Pakistan or we can select one for you if you like.


In the winter of 2012, Zia Imran and his friend Farrukh Kamran, struck up a conversation on how the natural gas bills were going through the roof during winter months and what could be done to reduce them. They figured that a large portion of a utility bill is because of inefficient household appliances especially the water heater. This is because the legacy thermostat's design is static and time independent: once you set the thermostat at a particular level, the water heater only maintains the water at that specific temperature, regardless of whether you are using hot water or not. Throughout a cold night, when no one is using water, the water heater continuously burns gas to heat water. This wastes the individual’s money, wastes the world’s energy resources and pollutes our atmospheres. Zia and Farrukh figured there must be an elegant way to make this thermostat intelligent and the water heater economical and eco-friendly. This is what they cooked up on a napkin by the end of the conversation.

One cold morning, Zia noticed this public information AD in the newspaper.  

This advertisement by the gas distribution company asks people to turn their thermostats to hot before they need warm water and then turn it off when they are done. How many people will get up at 5 in the morning to turn on the heater for when they need a shower at 5:30? Not many. And this is ignoring the discomfort of going outside in sub zero weather. 

This impractical suggestion motivated us more to do something about the energy problem.  




By winter of 2013, we had designed various product prototypes. We settled on a design close to our final production design shown below. We built 25 units laboriously by hand. 20 of these were deployed in the field and the response was awesome. In two days, our Facebook post resulted in a few hundred requests to get the device. Our users have been very happy and based on some of the feedback received, we have modified the hardware and software design, some details of which are provided below. 

Our hardware design is so efficient and uses so little energy that Jul Bujh can operate one full winter season without battery replacement. In fact the two AA cells that power the processor circuitry can last up to a year and a half, whilst the other two AA cells powering the motor will last full winter season. The hardware configuration has 3 main components: a motor, two optical sensors and a microcontroller. The motor rotates a shaft which is coupled with the “key” on the thermostat. The time for which the motor rotates is determined by feedback from the optical sensors and the microcontroller. The chip used is Texas Instruments’ CC2540. This chip can then communicate with your Bluetooth Smart mobile phone through BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy). Thus, the user tells the chip what to do through an App and, using feedback from optical sensors, the chips turns the motor on and off, hence rotating the thermostat key at the right time. Here is the assembly diagram, cross-section and circuit for Jul Bujh.

We care about how the product is packaged and shipped. Here is a concept design of our packaging. Although it doesn't have our branding yet but you can appreciate the care with which your Jul Bujh will be packaged and shipped. The packaging container would be so nice that we are sure you would like to keep it around! 

We have already built an Android App that connects with Jul Bujh wirelessly through BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) to program it and fetch battery status and diagnostic information. An iPhone app is in the works. The embedded software in the TI Chip has the capability to detect malfunctions of the motor drive. If the motor gets stuck for some reason the status is recorded and reported back to the user's phone when it comes in range (BLE has a line of sight range of 80 feet). The embedded software also keeps an eye on battery levels and reports low battery status to the phone so user can replace batteries.


We have put together a team of seasoned industry veterans and young engineers. We need your pledges to support a greener earth, reduce pollution, lower greenhouse gas emissions while saving households money that they are wasting today.

We need to get to volumes that justify investment in building dies and molds for mid to large scale production. We can only build a small number of units by hand. The process needs to be automated and that takes investment in working with vendors to setup production lines. We also need to make minimum purchase commitment for electronic parts and assembly to keep cost of the unit realistic. 

People say hardware is hard to do but we have assembled a great team, proven our concept in the field and demonstrated the value of our solution. The product pays for itself in less than four months. This ROI cannot be beat. 

If you take the case of Pakistan, a typical developing country, an average monthly gas bill is $70 for one geyser turned on to max for the full month. Using Jul Bujh, a person can typically achieve $20 in savings at the minimum. If you total that over at least 5 million households* across the nation, you obtain savings of at least $100 million every month. 

And that is just the monetary returns. There are the obvious environment benefits: fewer fossil fuels burnt means less carbon dioxide, fewer ozone damaging gases and decreased particulates in the air. Furthermore, decreased consumption of natural gas means the nation’s energy reserves sustain for a longer time. Cost of 1 unit of gas will stabilize as danger of overconsumption passes. This means that the underprivileged will not be priced out of natural gas. 


We say thank you to following individuals and institutions for their contributions to this project. Without their support at critical junctures, Jul Bujh would would not have been where it is today. 

Professor Belal Hashmi at FAST National University Lahore - affectionately known as Baoo Ji by his students for his selfless devotion to his student and teaching - for helping us debug our hardware. 

Dr Umar Suleman at FAST National University Lahore - for helping us with embedded software just when we thought we had hit a roadblock. 

Usman Younas of Arbisoft who helped us put together the video for gratis. He spent countless hours with us novices patiently putting up with missed dialogs and retakes.

Steve Moore for providing guidance over and above for what he signed up for.

Ashar Nisar for helping put together the Indiegogo page. He has always been there as a friend and facilitator in many of my foolish and not so foolish endeavors. I value your help and friendship a lot. 

Anser Hussain Siddiqui for your input on our campaign page and acting as a bouncing board for ideas. Thanks for being part of the project, you have been a great help.

CASE - Center for Advanced Studies in Engineering, Islamabad for letting us use their labs for our hardware debugging.

and most importantly Babar Ahmad (Mindstorm Studios) and Jehan Ara (PASHA) for their material support and encouragement - It just would not have been possible without them. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts. 


Risks & Challenges

Let's face it, hardware is difficult to do. Especially hardware which involves multiple technologies like Jul Bujh does. Jul Bujh needs three distinct set of expertise, software, hardware design and mechanical and industrial design. We have tried reducing the risk for Indiegogo community by not only developing a prototype but producing and installing 20 units last winter in the field to learn from our customers.

Based on this feedback we have altered the design a bit, added more software features and moved the process form a hand made approach to a mass production process. This conversion to larger scale production and debugging the final design is going on right now. We are very confident that given the experience of the team and our ability to build 20 units and install them successfully in the field will enable us to automate production of larger batches of units by first week of November so we are ready for production runs by end of November.
story_txt:
Jul Bujh is a snap on retrofit device that improves the efficiency of millions of legacy water heaters across the globe, making them eco-friendly









Installation videos will be available for download through our web site close to shipment date of the product.


The Apps will be available for download from respective official App stores for iPhone and Android platforms at the time of product shipment.



All Jul Bujh devices in all packages can be shipped to different addresses all over the world. All devices can also be donated for install at a not for profit facility. We can install on your behalf at a location of your choice in Pakistan or we can select one for you if you like.



In the winter of 2012, Zia Imran and his friend Farrukh Kamran, struck up a conversation on how the natural gas bills were going through the roof during winter months and what could be done to reduce them. They figured that a large portion of a utility bill is because of inefficient household appliances especially the water heater. This is because the legacy thermostat's design is static and time independent: once you set the thermostat at a particular level, the water heater only maintains the water at that specific temperature, regardless of whether you are using hot water or not. Throughout a cold night, when no one is using water, the water heater continuously burns gas to heat water. This wastes the individual’s money, wastes the world’s energy resources and pollutes our atmospheres. Zia and Farrukh figured there must be an elegant way to make this thermostat intelligent and the water heater economical and eco-friendly. This is what they cooked up on a napkin by the end of the conversation.




One cold morning, Zia noticed this public information AD in the newspaper.  



This advertisement by the gas distribution company asks people to turn their thermostats to hot before they need warm water and then turn it off when they are done. How many people will get up at 5 in the morning to turn on the heater for when they need a shower at 5:30? Not many. And this is ignoring the discomfort of going outside in sub zero weather. This impractical suggestion motivated us more to do something about the energy problem.  





By winter of 2013, we had designed various product prototypes. We settled on a design close to our final production design shown below. We built 25 units laboriously by hand. 20 of these were deployed in the field and the response was awesome. In two days, our Facebook post resulted in a few hundred requests to get the device. Our users have been very happy and based on some of the feedback received, we have modified the hardware and software design, some details of which are provided below. 





Our hardware design is so efficient and uses so little energy that Jul Bujh can operate one full winter season without battery replacement. In fact the two AA cells that power the processor circuitry can last up to a year and a half, whilst the other two AA cells powering the motor will last full winter season. The hardware configuration has 3 main components: a motor, two optical sensors and a microcontroller. The motor rotates a shaft which is coupled with the “key” on the thermostat. The time for which the motor rotates is determined by feedback from the optical sensors and the microcontroller. The chip used is Texas Instruments’ CC2540. This chip can then communicate with your Bluetooth Smart mobile phone through BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy). Thus, the user tells the chip what to do through an App and, using feedback from optical sensors, the chips turns the motor on and off, hence rotating the thermostat key at the right time. Here is the assembly diagram, cross-section and circuit for Jul Bujh.



We care about how the product is packaged and shipped. Here is a concept design of our packaging. Although it doesn't have our branding yet but you can appreciate the care with which your Jul Bujh will be packaged and shipped. The packaging container would be so nice that we are sure you would like to keep it around! 




We have already built an Android App that connects with Jul Bujh wirelessly through BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) to program it and fetch battery status and diagnostic information. An iPhone app is in the works. The embedded software in the TI Chip has the capability to detect malfunctions of the motor drive. If the motor gets stuck for some reason the status is recorded and reported back to the user's phone when it comes in range (BLE has a line of sight range of 80 feet). The embedded software also keeps an eye on battery levels and reports low battery status to the phone so user can replace batteries.

We can only build a small number of units by hand. The process needs to be automated and that takes investment in working with vendors to setup production lines. We also need to make minimum purchase commitment for electronic parts and assembly to keep cost of the unit realistic. 
People say hardware is hard to do but we have assembled a great team, proven our concept in the field and demonstrated the value of our solution. The product pays for itself in less than four months. This ROI cannot be beat. 

If you take the case of Pakistan, a typical developing country, an average monthly gas bill is $70 for one geyser turned on to max for the full month. Using Jul Bujh, a person can typically achieve $20 in savings at the minimum. If you total that over at least 5 million households* across the nation, you obtain savings of at least $100 million every month. 
And that is just the monetary returns. There are the obvious environment benefits: fewer fossil fuels burnt means less carbon dioxide, fewer ozone damaging gases and decreased particulates in the air. Furthermore, decreased consumption of natural gas means the nation’s energy reserves sustain for a longer time. Cost of 1 unit of gas will stabilize as danger of overconsumption passes. This means that the underprivileged will not be priced out of natural gas.

story:
GOAL ACHIEVED!!

Over the goal, even!
This means the scooter, shower bar, and housecleaning can all happen.
If it ends up continuing to build past the total goal it is now, I will use the extra money to catch up her super late rent.
THANK YOU EVERYONE that contributed, spread the word, and "liked" my post on Facebook.

YOU made this happen.


Momma's Struggle

My momma needs some help. She has been battling cancer for about 15 years and it's kicked into overdrive. Other medical issues aside, the Chemo, surgeries and medication has her so weak, she keeps falling. Recently, she fell and bashed her head on the pavement and broke her arm trying to make it to the bus for her doctor's appointment. I'm told she's also raw and blistered where the surgery happened and it's not healing. A mobility Scooter would make all the difference in the world to her and her children (my brother and sister can't leave her side because she keeps falling). She will continue need after she beats this stupid cancer as she also needs both of her knees replaced. I can fix her problems, but I am hopeful that with your help I can make things a little easier on her.

I need: $800

With this money, I will be able to buy momma the scooter in the photo, along with a shower rail that will allow her to keep balance while she lifts her leg into the tub. If this effort raises any more money than the goal, I will use it to hire her a professional house cleaner, because momma says her house is so dirty it's driving her crazy (apparently my siblings don't clean "as good as she does"). It will also take care of the chunk of money indiegogo takes for this campaign service. 

This is the scooter:  

http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00GPGKN4G/ref=wl_it_dp_o_pC_nS_ttl?_encoding=UTF8&colid=2GPZNRRE9OZVZ&coliid=I1O5NMN222072N


Your kindness will bring tears of relief

This scooter will not only give my momma an independence she hasn't felt in years (she's been in bed for several years now because walking hurts so bad) but it will let my little brother and sister leave her side. Neither of them graduated from high school due to their loyalty. They can't even get jobs. If momma can get around safely, maybe they can learn what independence feels like too.
