story:
Short Summary

Our angel, Abagayle Rose Muszynski, was born on 9-14-2011 with a very rare genetic birth disorder called Aicardi Syndrome. When Abagayle arrived in this world, she appeared to be a perfectly healthy baby except for an eye that would not open. This was the beginning of our nightmare, only it became a reality. 

Just a few weeks after her birth, Abby was poked, prodded, and led through EEG's, MRI's, Cat Scans and eye exams that forced her little eyes open by metal prongs and then dialated. All this led to her final devasting diagnoses which was delivered by a Pediatric Opthamalogist 6 weeks later. We will never forget that dreadful day. There we sat holding our baby girl in the doctor's chair, holding hands. The doctor came in and asked ... do you want "the good news first or bad news"? What an insane question to ask at a time like this. 

We were then told that our beautiful innocent baby girl was born with a very rare birth defect called Aicardi Syndrome. She would suffer with daily life threatening seizures, chronic pulmonary/breathing problems, and severe retardation. She may never walk, talk or function on her own. This was the bad news. Then the good news came...the doctor then told us "at least she wasn't a boy." Baby boys die in utero. To make matters even worse, we were told Abby had microphalymia (small eye) and was blind in her left eye. She also had Agensis of the Corpus Collosum where part of her brain is missing. These additional medical problems were part of the markers for the Aicardi disease. This news was the beginning of a devasting journey for which we were about to embark.

And here were are now...nine months later where Baby Abby, seeks to amaze us every day. She wakes every day with a smile that lights up the room. She kicks and puts her hands up with she sees Mommy or Daddy enter the room - but she struggles to lift her head or body as she has no head control. She tries to suck her thumb and sometimes gets it to her mouth but sometimes she is too shaky with her hands. And music seems to comfort her most as she falls asleep with her favorite lullaby.

Abby has many special needs that we cannot meet alone. Therefore, we are asking humbly for your help.

Since Abby's birth, mom has had to resign from her job to care for Abby on a full time basis. Dad works but resources are very limited. Abby has no insurance and out of pocket medical expenses are unmanageable. We cannot meet Abby's medical, physical and basic daily needs.

Abby currently wears a conformer in her left eye that needs to be treated and fitted by an ocularist on a regular basis. This helps her eye socket and muscles to develop and grow so that her eyes will appear normal and the same size. Insurance does not pay for this continued treatment. We are seeking help for Abby to get a new prosthetic eye and continue treatment.

Abby takes several medications and treatments to control her daily seizures. We are seeking help to cover the costs of the medications that are not covered by insurance. Some of the medications come from Canada and other areas of the world and they are not covered by insurance. These medications are vital to control her seizures.

Abby requires special equipment for her physical therapy, speech therapy, and vision therapy which is not covered. Some of these items include a future wheel chair, special seats, strollers, car seats, ramps, special needs van, housing, visual aids and many more items.

Every penny makes a difference to us. We are all faced with difficult times, so if you are unable to give please help us to spread the word and share our story so that maybe it will get the attention it needs.

Aicardi Sydrome is a very rare disease and there are not many organizations or charities out there for support. We hope that someday we will have the attention we need for the funding of our little "angels."

story:
Friends, family and loved ones of Jamie:

This is to raise funds for Jamie's mother, Jacquie. We want to show her love and support and this is one of many ways to help her out a little.

Art from Jack Case, Ant, massages and more perks to be added, everything is significant and very appreciated.

story:
Aug. 10, 2013, NY Times: California’s state prisons are dangerously overcrowded. In 2011, the United States Supreme Court found that the overcrowding had gotten so bad — close to double the prisons’ designed capacity — that inmates’ health and safety were unconstitutionally compromised. 

The Training Center's "Prison Release Program" provides immediate transitional support designed for rehabilitation, redemption, and transformation.  

"Prison Release Program" 40 Days to Raise $40k+  

~ The Cure for the California Prison Overcrowding Epidemic ~

Aug. 2, 2013, L.A. Times: Los Angeles - “...In court filings this week the state said process of identifying thousands of inmates nearing the end of their prison terms deemed lowest risk of committing new crimes if released early would be finished in two weeks...” “...California already has begun to comply with a federal court order to reduce its prison count by 9,600 by the end of December 2013...”

PLEASE Donate ! 

San Diego Training Center 501(c)(3) Non-Profit 

Our Prison Release Program is a residential treatment program that consists of four phases of intensive treatment with two additional phases of aftercare. Each client will be provided with housing, individual and group counseling, alcohol and drug dependence counseling and education, treatment planning, anger management, life skills, individual therapy with on site MFT, stress management, relapse prevention, HIV & Hep-C education and pre-employment development. 

We are Ca. licensed providing a proficient staff that consists of certified AOD counselors, licensed MFT, and ordained ministers.


                 Gifts of gratitude for your partnership support

$5 - Sticker 

$10 - Stickers, 8x10 photo of a famous pro skater like Jay Adams, Christian Hosoi, Dave Hackett etc. 

$15 - Custom hat 

$20 - Custom hat and 8x10 skate photo 

$25 - Custom backpack, custom hat, and 8x10 skate photo 

$50 - Custom backpack, custom hat, T-shirt, and signed 8x10 skate photo 

$75 - Skateboard and custom backpack

$100 - Skateboard, custom backpack, custom hat, and T-shirt

$250 - Signed skateboard by the pros, signed 8x10 skate photo, DVD, custom hat, T-shirt, and custom backpack

$500 - Legends of Skate laser etched numbered collectors board of either Jay Adams, Steve Cathey or Gregg Weaver and Legends of Skate T-shirt

$1000 - Skate with Jay Adams, Legends of Skate Jay Adams laser etched numbered collectors board, Jay Adams 180 T-shirt (never seen before), Jay Adams backpack, and Jay Adams signed 8x10

$2500 - A full day with skate Legends, Jay Adams, Dave Hackett, Tony Magnusson, Dennis Martinez, John Pope, and others. Skate with the pros, have lunch, tour skateboard factory and see how skateboards are made. Receive a signed skateboard, custom backpack, T-shirt, custom hat, Osiris Shoes, and stickers.

           

    


                                 

           


           

                                             


Skate with Jay Adams

      

   

                 

  

We thank God for our sponsors:

Randy's Custom Screen Printing - Seven 6 Fifty - Osiris Shoes - Sullen Clothing - Concrete Wave Magazine - Dave Hackett Designs - Watson Laminants - Legends of Skate - Jay Adams - Christian Hosoi - Dave Hackett - Tony Magnusson - Dennis Martinez - John Pope   

Please Help Us By Supporting The Training Center Prison Release Program

story:
JOSIE'S SURGERY TOOK PLACE ON SUNDAY JULY 28! PLEASE SEE UPDATES BELOW

Josie Nordman, age 20, has cystic fibrosis, a genetic disease that she was diagnosed with at four months old. As time has progressed, so has her disease. After suffering a very large loss of lung function this past year, she progressed to end stage lung disease, and her only hope of living was to receive a lung transplant. On July 28 2013, a donor was found, a match was made and Josie underwent lung transplant surgery.

The financial cost of the surgery and ongoing medical expenses over the first year is astonomical. Josie's family is holding a series of fundraisers throughout the year to help pay for these expenses and would deeply appreciate any contributions. No donation is too small...whether you have $5 to spare or $50, any amount will help. Thank you in advance for keeping Josie in your thoughts.

Josie loves theater and horses.  She is a junior at Northwestern University where she studies theater and communications. She is an avid equestrian and until she got too sick to ride, she was part of Northwestern’s equestrian team. She also loves soccer and is a fan of Sporting Kansas City. Despite having spent most of her young life in the hospital, her positive and realistic outlook about her situation is an inspiration to everyone who meets her.

 

SURGERY UPDATE:

SATURDAY July 27 2013

7:00pm: A donor has been found. The lungs are a match. Josie is in the University of Chicago hospital and is awaiting surgery.

SUNDAY July 28 2013

4:00am Josie has been taken into the operating room and being prepped for surgery. There are still tests to be done on the donors lungs. Our deepest condolences go to the donor's family. Our thoughts and prayers are with them and with Josie at this time.

7:00am Surgery has begun. The first lung is ready to come out and the new one put in. We have a very long day ahead of us - this is an 8-12 hour surgery.

1:00pm Surgery is going well so far. Currently looks like it will be on the shorter end of the 8-12 hour time frame.

4:00pm Surgery is complete and Josie is doing well. She is now in ICU connected to a ventilator. She will be kept sedated for at least another 5 hours and then they will attempt to remove the ventilator. 

10:00pm Josie is sedated and comfortable but not ready for breathing tube to be removed.  The tube will hopefully be removed sometime tomorrow morning.

MONDAY July 29 2013

Josie's breathing tube has been removed and she is breathing by herself with her new lungs. She is awake and talking, in pain but doing great.

TUESDAY July 30 2013

Both chest tubes are now out. She is eating pumpkin seeds and potato chips. Today she took a walk around her room and into the corridors of the ICU with her new lungs.

WEDNESDAY July 31 2013

Josie has been moved to a regular room. She is off of oxygen completely and her oxygen saturation is 98%. 5 days ago she was showing sats of 80% or less off oxygen. She is finally realizing what it feels like to breath normally. Something she has not done in the past 7 years!!!

THURSDAY August 1 2013

Josie continues to improve at an astounding rate. Pain management is still an issue, but provided there are no setbacks or changes, Josie may be allowed to go home tomorrow. 

FRIDAY August 2 2013

Josie comes home from hospital this evening. Please know that while this is the end of one story, it is the beginning of another. We have a long uphill battle in front of us and will continue to need everyone's prayers and help long after this. Thanks to everyone who has been there through this past year's journey. I hope you will continue on this one with us.

story:
100% Autonomous.

100% Student Built.

We are a small group of students working to get to a national robotics competition in Colorado mid-June. 

Starting in the room of our friends house in the small town of Chico, CA, we've held big hopes for the future of both ourselves, and the future engineers and programmers of the world. And that's why this project is important. With your funding, we can reach out not only to national competitions, but also reach out to other students who share the same passion and drive as ourselves.

We are not in it just for ourselves. We are in it for our school, for the people who want to learn the skills needed for America's future greatness. We are in it not only to win, but to teach those around that dedication and hard work compose the road to success. 

But we need help.

We can't do it on our own.

If you'd like to help our little school in California produce the next engineers, programmers, scientists, and mathematicians, then lend us a fiscal hand. Even the smallest bit helps us make up for California's crumbling school funding.

And what are we uniting to make?

Meet Kingfish, the latest build of our ambitions.

Kingfish is based on simple ideas.

Deploy. Drive. Detect.

Each of these words denote a cornerstone of our mentality.

Deploy. Kingfish must be deployed at the start of the race, and will never be touched by human hands until it finishes. What do we mean? Kingfish is fully autonomous; there are no remotes, wires, or proxy controlling of any kind. 

Drive. Kingfish is powered by a small brushless electric motor, capable of propelling it to about 10MPH, which is not very fast. With greater funding, we can afford to buy a more powerful motor, and the LiOH (The same as in your cell phone) batteries required to keep it powered, along with the electrical equipment.

Detect. Kingfish "sees" its surroundings, and reacts accordingly. To do this, we use onboard computers to run a series of processes to "see" via a camera mounted on the top. First, we take an image, of which about thirty are produced every second. We then filter out the colors we don't need to see, and when we find a color we need, we detect the shape. Depending on the object it sees, Kingfish will either follow, or avoid the obstacle.

To find out more, visit our website at http://pvmechatronics.com/

story:
Once funding is received, I will be able to educate and empower people in all walks of life in any country to improve their health and positive attitude to achieve their goals and enjoy a better lifestyle

The funding will at first be utilised to employ people with expertise in marketing, promotion and sales of my books, plus to create a more professional video for Youtube and then to print books for free distribution in schools

My books I firmly believe are a valuable contribution to mankind to respect the planet, fellow humans and increase self worth and therefore improve everyones lifestyle

Anyone is welcome to contribute with funding, letting others know about my books, offering their expertise and being involved with this worthwhile project

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt: Once funding is received, I will be able to educate and empower people in all walks of life in any country to improve their health and positive attitude to achieve their goals and enjoy a better lifestyleThe funding will at first be utilised to employ people with expertise in marketing, promotion and sales of my books, plus to create a more professional video for Youtube and then to print books for free distribution in schoolsMy books I firmly believe are a valuable contribution to mankind to respect the planet, fellow humans and increase self worth and therefore improve everyones lifestyleAnyone is welcome to contribute with funding, letting others know about my books, offering their expertise and being involved with this worthwhile projectAnd that’s all there is to it.

story:
Renowned tennis  coach, Terence Scott, has created three amazing tennis training products; the XLP stationary trainer, XLP hand held trainer, and the X-Tremity trainer. Terence and his team are ready to bring this product to market and wants the Indie Gogo community to be a part of the initial launch.

 

 

Terence developed the idea for the XLP Tennis Trainer while he was training his daughter, Noel. Terence was frustrated by the tennis training tools available at the time because of the lack of productivity and the cost of these products.

Terence decided to use his expertise and create his own training system that would produce more effective results, be more affordable and cause less injuries. While training his daughter Noel, Terence used simple materials in the back of his house to create the first iteration of the XLP. This enabled Terence to train Noel at any point in time and in any location. With the aid of the early stage XLP Trainer, Noel improved her skills and went on to become a No. 1 USTA junior in the country and to obtain numerous athletic scholarships. Finally, Terence decided to take his concept a little further and fully develop the XLP Tennis Trainer to be easily be accessible and affordable to people across the world.

 

 

When sitting down to build the initial XLP Trainer, the goals were to create a training product that would:

 

  • Allow training anywhere, rain or shine. A lot of tennis training tools focused on being outside on the court, which could be affected by the weather. With XLP Tennis Training System, Terence is able to train his players indoor or outdoor while producing maximum and effective training.
     
  • Technique based training versus Results based training. Young and developing players often develop poor mechanics in an effort to achieve short term results. The XLP Tennis Training System eliminates the opportunity for players to lock into a poor technique, produce low impact  and drastically reduce the chances of injury.
     
  • Create opportunity to train multiple players simultaneously with or without a coach.
     
  • Give players an opportunity to work on every type of swing including serve.
     
  • Enables high performance training without using a basket of balls

 

 

 

Terence has developed many iterations of his trainer over the years, finally landing on three revolutionary products: The XLP stationary trainer; XLP handheld trainer; and X-Tremity attaching trainer.

 

 

 

The XLP Stationary trainer allows players to work on every type of ground stroke swing in a low impact, repeatable fashion. Players can train indoors or outdoors, with or without a coach or trainer. With the stationary trainer, players and coaches do not have to chase down or collect balls.

 

 

To develop a good serve, the XLP handheld trainer allows coaches and players to focus on developing the right mechanics on an overhead smash and serve.

 

 

The X-Tremity is a dynamic training tool that allows players to work on a variety of different swings at every possible angle. The X-Tremity can be easily attached to different items such as but not limited to; polls, fences and trees. The X-Tremity can be adjusted at any angle that is suitable for the player.

 

 

Terence has 20 years of experience as a tennis trainer and skills coach. His players have won numerous tournaments on the USTA Juniors, Professional Circuit, ITF, and NCAA levels.

Terence is the founder and the designer of the XLP Training Group and the XLP tennis training products. Terence was motivated to develop the XLP training products as a result of trying to find alternative ways to provide high level training to his players when inside courts weren’t available or due to  adverse weather condition.The XLP training system is  a game changer that will get you better, faster.

story:
Handball: It's Your Favorite Sport (You Just Don't Know It Yet)

Handball, or team handball, is a fast-paced, high-scoring Olympic sport, played between two teams on a court approximately the size of a basketball court. Seven (7) players, including a goalkeeper, from each team try to outscore their opponent by shooting a volleyball-sized ball into their opponent’s net. Each player can carry the ball for up to three steps before having to dribble, pass, or shoot, and anywhere between 30-50 goals are scored during a typical game.

As one of the most popular Olympic and professional sports in the world, handball has a worldwide following. During the 2016 Rio Olympics, handball was the second highest-ticketed sport, and over 800,000 people attended matches during the 2019 IHF Handball World Championships. On top of that, thousands of fans attend professional handball matches every week in countries like Germany, Sweden, and France. 

With the United States hosting the 2028 Olympics, Team USA will have to field an Olympic handball team for the first time since 1996.  

However, outside elementary school gym classes and a handful (pun intended) of amateur clubs, handball does not exist in the United States (which may explain why handball, along with table tennis and badminton, are the only sports that the USA has never won an Olympic medal in).

Detroit Handball Club is trying to that. 

DHC: Detroit Handball Club or Disrupting Handball Culture?

Yes. 

We started Detroit Handball Club because we want to see this amazing sport grow in the USA. 

We're setting out to do that by disrupting the way handball is currently watched, played, and taught by:

  1. Making handball fun to watch 
  2. Fielding the most dominant handball team in America
  3. Providing world-class instruction for aspiring handball players and coaches

By being the first handball club in America to take this approach, we believe we'll be able to get the ball rolling (another pun) on making the city of Detroit and the USA into handball powerhouses.

1.) Making Handball Fun To Watch 

Currently, handball in the United States is unwatchable. 

Club matches are scheduled sporadically from September to May, and typically take place during weekend-long tournaments in various cities across the country. Teams usually start playing in around 9 am and play anywhere from 2 to 5 matches in before 6 pm. On top of that, teams hardly ever play a matches in front of a home crowd. 

Detroit HC, as part of the newly-formed Great Lakes Team Handball League, are breaking this trend by: 

  1. Scheduling all home matches at 7 pm on Saturday nights
  2. Playing in a venue that can seat 350 rabid fans
  3. Playing in a venue that serves food AND alcoholic beverages

Every Saturday at 7 pm from March 28, 2020 to May 2, 2020, Detroit HC will play 6 home matches Detroit City Fieldhouse  (which has a full-service bar over looking the field) against clubs like

  • Pittsburgh Team Handball Club
  • Cincinnati HC
  • Columbus Armada HC (Ohio)
  • HC Toronto
  • Milwaukee United
  • Chicago Inter  

I know what you're probably thinking: "Why would I spend money and Saturday night watching an amateur team play a sport at a mediocre level?" 

Which brings us to our next point... 

2.) The "Globo Gym" Strategy

Similar to Ben Stiller in the 2004 film Dodgeball, Detroit HC is assembling a team of international-caliber players to compete against amateur opponents

Would you spend your Saturday night watching two teams of amateurs, who learned how to play the sport from gym class and YouTube, battle it out? No?

Replace one of those teams with a roster stocked with  semiprofessional and national team players from across Europe and Latin America. Now are you interested? 

We currently have agreements with:

  • 1 coach of a Swedish Division 1 club
  • 2 semi-professional players from Sweden (both on Division 1 clubs)
  • 1 member of the Australian National Team 
  • 4 members of the Puerto Rican National Team

The rest of the 15-man roster spots will be filled with athletes from Detroit.

(If you would like to tryout, please email detroithandballclub@gmail.com)

"Wait," you're probably thinking, "this doesn't seem fair to clubs in the USA, who are just amateurs and play handball because they love the sport." 

We understand that, but hear us out: In the United States, it's difficult for even the most dedicated handball player to compete against high-level competition. Unless one plays for the national team, it's unlikely that an American player will have the opportunity to test themselves against experienced teams and players from across the world, let alone play in an environment thats intense and electrifying. 

On top of that, if Detroit HC wins the USA Team Handball National Championship, we qualify for the IHF SuperGlobe Tournament in Saudi Arabia, where we'll play against the professional best clubs in the world.

Imagine: Detroit HC v. FC Barcelona Handbol.  

Pretty neat, eh?

3.) Full-Time Amateurs

                               Example of a fellow amateur sports team 

While our international players and coaches will not be professional, they will be full-time handball ambassadors during their time in Detroit. When they aren't training, Detroit HC players and coaches will host leagues and clinics for new handball players of all ages and skill levels. 

Specifically, our Puerto Rican players will be able to engage and inspire members of the Hispanic community in Detroit.

Through offering recreational leagues and clinics, our hope is to not only introduce Detroiters to a new and fun sport, but to also use the global reach of handball to make the world smaller for every person Detroit HC engages.

Will you help us get the (hand)ball rolling?       

In order to do this right, we'll have raise around a substantial amount of money so that we can cover basic living expenses for our players (rent, travel, etc.), equipment, gym space, and other costs associated with a sports team of this caliber. 

No contribution is too small, and we have a lot of cool stuff to giveaway as a thank you for your support! :) 

By helping Detroit HC, you're not only helping to start a unique sports team in the coolest city on earth, you're also playing an important role in growing a new sport in the United States of America!

Thank you!

story:
My Story

My name is Kara Dudley.  

My older cousin and big brother, Ryan William Snyder, passed away 4 years ago on November 5, 2010 as the result of a drug overdose.  He struggled with addiction for years and the disease eventually took his life at the young age of 21. 

Addiction took him away from his loving family, admiring friends, and ultimately the whole wide world world that he lived in.  This year, we are changing the game. 

We are assembling a team of friends, family, and strangers alike, that will not participate in substances, (drugs and alcohol) for the entire month of November.

This November we have a mission: to start a movement to raise awareness for addiction, gather a group of people that will unite for 30 days to take back control from addiction and stand up to do something to learn and grow instead.

What To Do

We ask that you post a picture for each day in November that you choose to do something else.  

Go to dinner with a friend, take a tour of a museum, hang out with your mom, write a song, sit outside and stare at the stars, take a bike ride, write a poem, meet someone new, learn a new skill, read a book, play solitaire.  Anything.

Post your daily picture with the hashtag, #WhatIDidInstead and let the challenge begin.  Invite family and friends to participate along with us.

    What To Contribute

    You can contribute anything.  I will contribute all the money that I do not spend on going out and buying alcohol this month.  You can also nominate people to join the movement and to join us in our challenge.  All of the proceeds will go to FOHAT, an organization started by Ryan's mom and her friend who also lost her son as well.  They are raising awareness for drug addiction in schools in Erie, PA and providing schools with materials and resources to fight back.

    https://www.facebook.com/pages/FOHAT/3017848898...

story:
[EN]


On his innocent face touched by pain, from time to time a shy smile makes its place. He knows he is sick, feels very weak, but still believes that, despite everything, one day he’ll get well.

At the age of only 13 Mihai is fighting a hard battle with cancer. The boy has an aggressive brain tumour (the full diagnosis shows an expansive, recidivating gangliar process  in the right side of the cerebral falx). The disease was detected at only 7 years when it affected his sight. Mihai's parents say they will never forget this day which changed entirely the life of this family.

The disease has progressed very rapidly since then.  In 2008 the boy has gone through 3 neurosurgical interventions. At just one week from the first intervention the second followed and in June, this year - the third one.

The young boy has long lost the feeling of a normal childhood by spending so much time in hospitals and fighting physical pain.

Mihai lags in growth, has hormonal dysfunctions and after the second operation has also been diagnosed with diabetes insipidus. He also has teeth problems which cause terrible pains and the dentists are afraid to treat him because of the associated risks.

The boy had also a cardiac arrest and was in a state of coma for 3 weeks.

Currently Mihai is going through hell, he can't go out or attend school. The disease has changed him a lot, he cried and was close to entering a depression although this is very unfamiliar for children of his age.

The treatment and the medical interventions carried in the local medical institutions, here in Moldova, attained very little.

"We have been advised to go to Germany for treatment but the prices were excruciating", said Liliana with a sigh, "we just don't have such money. Nevertheless, our consulting doctor has told us that the specialists from a highly equipped, proficient clinic in Turkey can help us in our case. The operation alone would cost about 17.000 euro which is still a lot for our modest budget but we truly hope to gather these money."

“We are determined to fight no matter what” says Mihai's mother Liliana. Despite all the difficulties, she has always been by her child trying to comfort him and to ease his pain. The family is ready for everything to change Mihai's fate but for that your help is also crucial.

This story has appeared in a few instances in the local mass media (see links below) and has received a number of contributions, however giving the economic hardships in Moldova and the relative frequency of such cases, the local contributions, are often insufficient to cover the needs.

There are multiple ways you could contribute financially to this case. You can either make a regular donation via Indiegogo or transfer the money to one of the following accounts (in one of the available currencies which you find convenient). You may also contact directly Mihai's family at  (+373) 69649704.

This case was featured in:

Unimedia.info (2nd most popular online news portal in Moldova) 

http://unimedia.info/stiri/Mihai-are-tumoare-la-creier-dar-vrea-sa-traiasca.-Tu-il-poti-ajuta-83426.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss

Curentul.md 

http://curentul.md/social/micutul-care-duce-o-lupta-crincena-cu-viata-il-poti-ajuta.html

Ziarulnational.md   

http://ziarulnational.md/targ-caritabil-pentru-a-l-ajuta-pe-mihaita/

 http://ziarulnational.md/apel-mihaita-are-nevoie-de-ajutorul-nostru-copilul-este-intre-viata-si-moarte/

[RO]

Mihăiță e băiețelul doamnei care ne zîmbește aproape în fiece dimineață. La job. Ideea e că, în spatele acestei joie de vivre aparentă, e tupilată o poveste. Tristă. Care are nevoie vitală de un sfârșit fericit. 
Băiețelul are doar 13 anișori și are o tumoare la creier, diagnostic complet: Proces expansiv recidivant ganglinofil în regiunea falxului cerebral pe dreapta, iar tratamentul și intervențiile chirurgicale nu au dat nici un rezultat. Să se facă bine îl pot ajuta însă medicii de la o clinică din Turcia, Istanbul, băiatul a fost acceptat pentru o evaluare terapeutică, dar pentru asta părinții au nevoie de o sumă de bani care este mult prea mare pentru bugetul lor modest. Părinții spun că nu vor uita niciodată ziua în care au aflat despre verdictul crunt al medicilor, care le-a schimbat radical viața. Boala a fost depistată la 7 ani, atunci cînd i-a fost afectată vederea. Apoi au urmat ani întregi, petrecuți în spitalele din țară, dar fără șanse. Băiețelul a suportat 3 operații neochirurgicale în anul 2008, la o săptămînă după prima intervenție a urmat și cea de-a doua intervenție, iar anul curent în luna iunie, Mihăiță a suferit cea de-a 3 intervenție chirurgicală. Tot în anul 2008, i-a fost aplicat șunt ventriculo-peritoneal pe dreapta. Boala se agravează, băiețelul a avut și un stop cardiac, a fost în comă, timp de 3 săptămîni, a fost paralizat și pe lîngă toate astea mai este diagnosticat și cu diabet insipid, din cauza asta are probleme dentare serioase, care îi provoacă dureri insuportabile, iar medicii-stomatologi nu vor să-și asume riscul să-l trateze. În ciuda tuturor greutăților, mama nu și-a părăsit nici pentru o clipă puiul, familia a renunțat la tot pentru ai schimba destinul copilului său. Mihăiță trece printr-un adevărat calvar, boala nu-i prea permite să iasă din casă, și nici să meargă la școală, din cauza că se simte foarte slăbit și luptă din răsputeri ca să rămînă în viață. Mihăiță suferă, a fost în prag de depresie, a plîns (deși, pentru vîrsta lui nu sunt caracteristice asemenea stări), boala l-a maturizat foarte mult. Familia băiatului trece peste momente îngrozitoare și speră că oamenii binevoitori nu vor rămîne indiferenți. Cei care vor să-l ajute pe Mihăiță să învingă boala, pot depune bani în contul bancar afișat mai jos, sau pot lua legătura cu părinții baiatului.


Tel. 069649704 , Cotorobai Liliana, mama

story_txt:
[EN]
On his innocent face touched by pain, from time to time a shy smile
makes its place. He knows he is sick, feels very weak, but still believes that,
despite everything, one day he’ll get well.
At the age of only 13 Mihai is fighting a hard battle with cancer. The
boy has an aggressive brain tumour (the full diagnosis shows an expansive, recidivating
gangliar process 
in the right side of the cerebral falx). The disease was detected at
only 7 years when it affected his sight. Mihai's parents say they will never
forget this day which changed entirely the life of this family. 
The disease has progressed very rapidly since then.  In 2008 the boy has gone through 3
neurosurgical interventions. At just one week from the first intervention the
second followed and in June, this year - the third one. 
The young boy has long lost the feeling of a normal childhood by
spending so much time in hospitals and fighting physical pain.
Mihai lags in growth, has hormonal dysfunctions and after the second
operation has also been diagnosed with diabetes insipidus. He also has
teeth problems which cause terrible pains and the dentists are afraid to treat
him because of the associated risks.
The boy had also a cardiac arrest and was in a state of coma for 3
weeks. 
Currently Mihai is going through hell, he can't go out or attend
school. The disease has changed him a lot, he cried and was close to entering a
depression although this is very unfamiliar for children of his age. 
The treatment and the medical interventions carried in the local
medical institutions, here in Moldova, attained very little. 
"We have been advised to go to Germany for treatment but the
prices were excruciating", said Liliana with a sigh, "we just don't
have such money. Nevertheless, our consulting doctor has told us that the
specialists from a highly equipped, proficient clinic in Turkey can help us in
our case. The operation alone would cost about 17.000 euro which is still a lot
for our modest budget but we truly hope to gather these money." 
“We are determined to fight no matter what” says Mihai's mother Liliana.
Despite all the difficulties, she has always been by her child trying to
comfort him and to ease his pain. The family is ready for everything to change
Mihai's fate but for that your help is also crucial.
This story has appeared in a few instances in the local mass media
(see links below) and has received a number of contributions, however giving
the economic hardships in Moldova and the relative frequency of such cases, the
local contributions, are often insufficient to cover the needs.
There are multiple ways you could contribute financially to this case.
You can either make a regular donation via Indiegogo or transfer the money to
one of the following accounts (in one of the available currencies which you
find convenient). You may also contact directly Mihai's family at  (+373) 69649704.
This case was featured in:
Unimedia.info
(2nd most popular online news portal in Moldova)  
http://unimedia.info/stiri/Mihai-are-tumoare-la-creier-dar-vrea-sa-traiasca.-Tu-il-poti-ajuta-83426.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss
Curentul.md  
http://curentul.md/social/micutul-care-duce-o-lupta-crincena-cu-viata-il-poti-ajuta.html
Ziarulnational.md   
http://ziarulnational.md/targ-caritabil-pentru-a-l-ajuta-pe-mihaita/
 http://ziarulnational.md/apel-mihaita-are-nevoie-de-ajutorul-nostru-copilul-este-intre-viata-si-moarte/

[RO]Mihăiță e băiețelul doamnei care ne zîmbește aproape în fiece dimineață. La job. Ideea e că, în spatele acestei joie de vivre aparentă, e tupilată o poveste. Tristă. Care are nevoie vitală de un sfârșit fericit. Băiețelul are doar 13 anișori și are o tumoare la creier, diagnostic complet: Proces expansiv recidivant ganglinofil în regiunea falxului cerebral pe dreapta, iar tratamentul și intervențiile chirurgicale nu au dat nici un rezultat. Să se facă bine îl pot ajuta însă medicii de la o clinică din Turcia, Istanbul, băiatul a fost acceptat pentru o evaluare terapeutică, dar pentru asta părinții au nevoie de o sumă de bani care este mult prea mare pentru bugetul lor modest. Părinții spun că nu vor uita niciodată ziua în care au aflat despre verdictul crunt al medicilor, care le-a schimbat radical viața. Boala a fost depistată la 7 ani, atunci cînd i-a fost afectată vederea. Apoi au urmat ani întregi, petrecuți în spitalele din țară, dar fără șanse. Băiețelul a suportat 3 operații neochirurgicale în anul 2008, la o săptămînă după prima intervenție a urmat și cea de-a doua intervenție, iar anul curent în luna iunie, Mihăiță a suferit cea de-a 3 intervenție chirurgicală. Tot în anul 2008, i-a fost aplicat șunt ventriculo-peritoneal pe dreapta. Boala se agravează, băiețelul a avut și un stop cardiac, a fost în comă, timp de 3 săptămîni, a fost paralizat și pe lîngă toate astea mai este diagnosticat și cu diabet insipid, din cauza asta are probleme dentare serioase, care îi provoacă dureri insuportabile, iar medicii-stomatologi nu vor să-și asume riscul să-l trateze. În ciuda tuturor greutăților, mama nu și-a părăsit nici pentru o clipă puiul, familia a renunțat la tot pentru ai schimba destinul copilului său. Mihăiță trece printr-un adevărat calvar, boala nu-i prea permite să iasă din casă, și nici să meargă la școală, din cauza că se simte foarte slăbit și luptă din răsputeri ca să rămînă în viață. Mihăiță suferă, a fost în prag de depresie, a plîns (deși, pentru vîrsta lui nu sunt caracteristice asemenea stări), boala l-a maturizat foarte mult. Familia băiatului trece peste momente îngrozitoare și speră că oamenii binevoitori nu vor rămîne indiferenți. Cei care vor să-l ajute pe Mihăiță să învingă boala, pot depune bani în contul bancar afișat mai jos, sau pot lua legătura cu părinții baiatului.Tel. 069649704 , Cotorobai Liliana, mamaPentru transfer în lei:BANCA DE ECONOMII S.A. filiala nr. 1, Str. story:
Help us purchase an ambulance for the Barisal Community   in Barisal city Bangladesh. So that some patient may be able to reach in the cities where they can receive better treatment.

Who are  Barisal Community Helper.

Barisal Community helper are Allaudin Khan, a part-time businessman who teaches and gives  time as he can to the clinic, and two (sub)surgeons, Dr. Mezanr Rahman and Dr. Musharraf.


Where is Barisal?


Barisal is a port city on the Kirtankhola river, located on the northern shore of the Bay of Bengal 

in southern Bangladesh. It is 373 km by road from Bangladesh’s capital city, Dhaka. Barisal has a population of over 270,000, and while there are hospitals and clinics here, those in the poorer neighborhoods are ill-equipped and there is not enough bed-space for all of the patients. 


An Ambulance for  Barisal Community.

Only about half of the people who live in the neighborhood near  the Clinics (hospitals) are able to acquire medical care. Even then, they can only receive basic treatment. It's hard to imagine the situation patient go through when you know you cannot reach on hospital because there is no proper transport. That's is a situation where anyone could spend anything to be out of it.

Anyone who requires advance treatment needs to be taken to Dhaka, and because the roads are not good and the distance is long (it is a 10 hour journey), most people unfortunately do not make it. The Clinics has no ambulances, and available Ambulances are converted normal cars which are lack of equipment  so there is as yet no way to take someone except by regular cars or by boats.  

To help these patients, Barisal Community helper are raising funds to purchase an ambulance That will be able to take patient to other cities hospital free of charges or on minimum fares.Your little contribution means a lot to us.


Ambulance Angels: We Need You


A fully-equipped ambulance and the means to keep it stocked and ready to help transport patients when necessary is estimated to cost $40,000.

-Import it to Bangladesh:$4000
-Documents clearance:$1000
-Start operation (driver,fuel,operation office) : $3000
-Indiegogo fees: $2000

Your contribution will enable us to: 

Give patients a better chance of surviving on their journey to a hospital in Dhaka city for advanced medical treatment free of cost specially for poor. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate! We have many great perks for supporting our campaign and in return for your generosity we have few rewards in return to make sure that what you have done remain in your memories and ours.

Retweet and share! Follow @BSAService on Twitter and Facebook Barisal shabah ambulance service

story:
Short Description

A friends little son had to go to the hospital a few days ago because he fall badly on his head. He had to stay there for almost a week and he was very unhappy. The room he stayed in was like a normal hospital room. The walls where painted in some grey and light yellow, but that was it. No colorful pictures for the kids to look at.

When i was 4 years old, I had to go to the hospital too. There they had one wall in every room covered completely with fairytail pictures like Snowwhite or Bambi.

This made my stay so much more fun and so much less frightening.

Now we try to raise money to repaint the rooms or at least hang a view fun paintings.
Another thing, that is missing is a colorful fun area for the kids to play at. Maybe like this one from a hospital somewhere in Asia.

This is a picture of the current play area:

Another great feature would be a little reading corner where parents or older siblings can pick up a book and read to the little ones.

What you get out of it...

Our plan is to paint a 1cm x 1cm square for each euro someone spends on a 1m x 1m square canvas (We do this twice of course). When we really reach our goal to fill the complete canvas, we will raffle it of to one of you.

We will also have little thank you notes and pictures from the kids in the hospital.

How you can help us?

Every Euro you can spare helps a great deal. If you don't have any money and want to help anyway? Tell people about this campaign! Share on twitter, facebook and everywhere else you can think of! Talk about us!

story:
Everybody deserves a great smile.

For over a decade, straighter teeth with invisible aligners have cost a small fortune. SmileCareClub wants to change that so everyone can afford a perfect smile.

This Indiegogo Pre-Launch Program allows us to see what percentage of patients are candidates for our invisible aligner program. Check out our Impression Instruction Video and you will see that taking an accurate impression is pretty straightforward. If you are not a candidate for our program, we will refund your purchase price of the smile kit. What do you have to lose?


Get straighter teeth and a brighter smile for 80% less than braces or traditional invisible aligners you'd get from a dentist's office. The best value in high-quality invisible aligners, SmileCareClub straightens and whitens your teeth completely from home. That's right, say goodbye to hassle and inconvenience of orthodontist waiting rooms. Every part of the SmileCareClub process can take place in the comfort of your home, from initial impressions to your smile assessment, to alignment and whitening.

Unlike traditional braces, our aligners are removable and  invisible, so you can look the same while you straighten and whiten.

Everything from our aligners to our board-certified team of orthodontists is industry proven. Crafted from high-tech and high-quality transparent plastic, the aligners are safe, precise and nearly invisible.

Each SmileCareClub Indiegogo patient will receives an assessment by a team of real orthodontists. Our cutting-edge evaluation process allows for careful and precise review to make certain you are a perfect candidate before you make your investment. Did we mention this is all from home?  It all starts with a photo assessment and home impression kit.


Once we review your photos and begin shipping Impression Kits, it only takes 2 weeks to receive your case assessment.  That means you will then know if this product is right for you.  Your discount voucher will be good for the discount once we go live with orthodontic services and begin shipping aligners.

How SmileCareClub Compares (@ Indigogo Pre-Launch Pricing)

About SmileCareClub

SmileCareClub is focused on making cosmetic dentistry accessible to everyone: we want to make a difference and inspire people to smile more.  SmileCareClub was founded in 2013 by Doug Hudson, whose track record includes HearingPlanet.com, Songbird Hearing Aids, DiabetesCareClub and CPAPCareClub, with David Katzman whose track record includes 1800contacts, Quicken Loans, Fathead, Sharper Image Online, RealAge, and the Cleveland Cavaliers.

Feedback from Clinical Studies

"I didn't wear my retainers after having braces as a teen, and eventually my teeth moved back.  This was all I needed to realign my smile."

"I wanted to close the gap in my 2 front teeth - but who wants to spend $5,000 for braces." 

"No way can I make multiple office visits.  Being able to do it at home - on my schedule finally made it work for me."


Frequently Asked Questions

What are SmileCareClub invisible aligners?

SmileCareClub invisible aligners are a series of tight-fitting, custom-made plastic retainers that gradually shift teeth into their desired position.

How do SmileCareClub invisible aligners straighten teeth?

SmileCareClub invisible aligners come as a set of 5 aligners (5 for your upper teeth, 5 for your lower teeth). Each aligner will make slight adjustments to tooth position, a process that is mapped out in advance by our team of orthodontists, specifically for your case. Approximately every three weeks, you will begin wearing a new set of aligners, advancing you to the next stage of your treatment. 

What are SmileCareClub invisible aligners made of?

SmileCareClub invisible aligners are made of a smooth, comfortable, BPA-free plastic that won't irritate your cheeks and gums like traditional metal braces often do.

How do I know if I’m right for SmileCareClub invisible aligners?

Every SmileCareClub order begins with a free Smile Assessment to determine if you are a suitable candidate for our invisible aligners. Our invisible aligner system is designed for minor to moderate teeth correction. This includes space between teeth, crowding, and rotations.

How long is the typical treatment process?

The typical treatment length for SmileCareClub invisible aligners is 4 months. The typical SmileCareClub member will receive a set of 5 aligners that need to be worn every 3 weeks. Some members receive slightly more or fewer aligners depending on the degree of teeth straightening needed.

How often must I wear my aligners?

You should wear your aligners at least 22 hours a day, only taking them out to eat, brush, or floss.

Should my teeth hurt during treatment?

Most people experience tooth soreness for a few days after wearing new aligners. This is perfectly normal. It is a sign that your aligners are working, gently moving your teeth to their final destination. This soreness should gradually go away after the first few days of a new set.

Are there any visits to an Orthodontist’s office during treatment?

There are zero visits to an Orthodontist's office during SmileCareClub’s invisible aligner treatment. From the first assessment, through every step of aligning your new smile, SmileCareClub straightens your teeth completely from home.

Can I consult with a SmileCareClub Orthodontist during my invisible aligner treatment?

Yes! Our team of SmileCareClub board-certified Orthodontist are available 24/7 to answer any questions you have during treatment.

story:
NEW FITNESS PERK!

Please email: NoExcusesTour@theOagency.com

 with your preferred style, size, and

 shipping address.

 

    

In an effort to raise awareness and help motivate personal fitness and healthy lifestyle satisfaction, BodyBYBakari is seeking your help in funding an exciting and life-changing fitness tour. The tour titled "No Excuses" is the sequel to the FREE bootcamps which were held in the Washington, DC metropolitan area every weekend in the summer of 2013. 

The BodyByBakari team will dedicate the entire summer giving back to those who have supported tremendously while having fun and getting fit at the same time! 

     

1. Trainers are too expensive! Not this time, this workout is 100% FREE!

2. I don't have enough time! Lasting only about 30 min. long, this workout is short yet effective and you'll feel great afterwards! 

3. It's hard and frustrating! "I Make Fitness Fun" is BodyBYBakari's personal mantra. Laugh, enjoy, and motivate each other to finish strong! 

PS: We're also handing out free goodies and giveaways from our supporters and sponsors! What else can you ask for during a workout!

      

In order to conduct this East Coast Fitness Tour, $10,000 is needed to cover the costs of necessary promotional and transportation elements. 

Your donation to this campaign contributes to:

-A Tour Van w/ an aggressive PR health & fitness strategy

-Multi-city Promotions

-Distribution of Merchandise and Giveaways

-Tour Video and Editing Capabilities 

-Online target marketing 

-Traveling Expenses

- Legal Fee's and Additional Permits

With more donations raised, the further we can promote this campaign, in addition to adding more cities, and ultimately influencing change on a mass scale. 

     

              Custom Motivational Gym Shirt

You're in the gym, you're tired and exhausted. This shirt will allow you to focus, dig deep and push yourself one more time. Stay Motivated. No Excuses. 

Add your name or a friend's. Size Small - XL available. Made with 100% Cotton.

                  No Excuses Tank Top Options

Any style and color combination available. All Tanks Uni-Sex & 100% Cotton

Note: All donations at any level will automatically be given 1 raffle ticket for the opportunity to win an amazing Nike+ GPS Sports Watch valued at $145!  Drawing will be held immediately after this campaign. To increase raffle tickets, simply click the button at the top of this page to share via Facebook OR post on Instagram and tag @BodyByBakari & #NoExcusesTour. 

                       1 Share or Post = 1 Raffle (No Limits on Shares & Posts)

**Share any photo you like just remember to Tag @BodyBYBakari and #NoExcusesTour

All items will ship immediately after the end of the campaign. Please expect an email to be sent following donation to obtain shirt size and styles within 24 hours. 

   

If you are unable to financially contribute to the campaign, you still can play a vital role by sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and all other social media platforms. It is only with all of us working together that we can make this exciting fitness tour happen. 

We trust you will join us.

-Andrew Nguyen, Bakari Taylor

Directors of BodyBYBakari INC.

* *We can still use a great deal of help in the fields of marketing, graphic design, event planning, and production etc. To lend your unique skills to this campaign, please email at NoExcusesTour@theOagency.com

story:
My name is Sue Miks. I am a BSRN at St Patricks Hospital in Missoula Montana.  My parents had a small medical clinic when I was young and I watched them provide safe medical care to those that could not afford it.  Receiving canned goods, a dinner, or a hand shake and thank you, in exchange for medical care.  It has always been a passion of mine to be able to provide compassionate, safe care to people in need.  I volunteered with Missoula Medical Aid providing medical care to villages in Honduras and found it very rewarding.  I spent some time on the Crow reservation in MT and understand, even in our own country, the need for safe medical care.  I hope to be able to offer care to areas internationally, and in trible health with in the U.S.   

I currently am part of a group heading to Africa May 20th, 2015 to spend a little over two weeks in a medical clinic in the village of Sakila and outreach villages.  I have committed to raising at least $5000 for this mission.  This mission is to provide medical aid to those in need and we are working for a ministry that is established in Tanzania called IEO.  The are a ministry that has been in the country for over 30 years.  IEO organizes teams like the one I will be part of, to provide medical care, and they also are involved in projects drilling wells for clean water, building trade schools to teach carpentry, welding, masonry, and sewing and other valuable work skills.  They have built orphanages to provide safe housing and quality education to orphaned children. 

Each member of the medical team is asked to volunteer their skills and time and raise at least $5000.  The monies will pay for our travel to the villages, immunizations, clinic/medical supplies, and provide procedures that individuals would not otherwise be able to receive.  They will be able to have procedures done with in a safe hospital and the monies raised will cover the hospital expense.  We will also be collecting items to leave there such as eye glasses, shoes, vitamins, clothing, fungal creams, eyedrops, toothbrushes and much more.  Some of these items may seem insignificant because most of us can buy them for mininal costs at multiple store but to the individuals of these villages that are not availalbe and not affordable.

I feel that being involved in organizations providing care to individuals in need, seeing the smiles on their faces and involving yourself in the culture are more rewarding than words can describe.

Please help in providing safe care to these individuals.  I am committed, can I count on you?

This is a non profit organization 501(c)(3) tax ID 91-1699853 - please consider helping a great cause and please pass this along to others for their support as well. 

Thank you -

Peace and light -

story:
Premise

A cross between ‘E:60’ and ‘This Week in Baseball’, Varsity Life: Around the OUA is a 24-minute Canadian university sport magazine show that appeals to the human-interest side of competitive sport. Two pilot episodes will be produced that will focus on Ontario University Athletics. Each episode will consist of 4-6 pre-produced features on compelling stories, both on and off the field, which develop throughout the season.

Content

The program will showcase an inside look at the various struggles, successes, personal developments, and emotions student athletes experience. The pre-produced features will contain interviews with athletes, coaches, families, and local journalists, as well as b-roll shot on-location, and game footage. Production will begin the weekend of October 24th, 2014, and conclude in mid-January. Studio portions will be shot in January 2015. The show will be completed in February 2015.

Need

Our executive group is expected to fund this project with no financial assistance from the university. With a budget in the thousands of dollars it will be difficult for us to achieve a professional finished project while relying on personal funding.

story:
Art For Health

"I have discovered and proved that art lessens my pain until erasing it. When I’m working with my camera I become so immersed in what it shows me that my own body becomes secondary".

About myself. About LIFE.


"He descubierto y comprobado que el arte disminuye mi dolor hasta el punto de llegar a borrarlo, cuando llevo mi cámara y fotografío, me adentro tanto en lo que veo que mi cuerpo pasa a un segundo plano".
Acerca de mi. Acerca de LIFE.


(bajar para leer versión en castellano)


My "not so brief" story of health


I was diagnosed with Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) when I was 14. Since then I’ve understood what it’s like to live in pain. 10 years ago my RA entered on remission stage and today, except for the unmistakable signs my body shows, which personalize and characterize me, arthritis is almost nonexistent on most of its symptoms.

Over a year and a half ago I started to feel pain again, but a different kind: it was permanent, muscular. Months of appointments with public health service doctors, physical therapies, all kinds of tests, and still no one understood what could be causing my new pain.

They all insisted it could be caused by the many hours I spent working in front of the computer, but the truth is that my pain kept growing and growing, until on February 24th I arrived in the ER with a pain that wouldn't even let me breath.  I was forced to take a sick-leave and stop going to work.

Finally, on March 20th -my mother just arriving from Caracas- they gave me the sensed diagnose: Fibromyalgia. I had heard of it but had no idea of what it was or meant. I tried to put some of my experience with arthritis into it by attacking the condition on time to cut its space, but sadly the response from Social Security was slow and erroneous, and without me even knowing, the syndrome had already built up.

Fortunately, I have learned about a doctor who assures the syndrome has a cure -and I have no doubt- but appointments are expensive and not covered by any type of insurance. Even so I didn't hesitate, having heard the positive experience of a girl that had gone through the same situation was my main motivation, and on April 8th I went to my first appointment. Since that day I began evolving favorably.


What it means to live with my condition

Ever since that first appointment, the Doctor was very clear in warnings and recommendations:

- It is important to not stay alone. I am blessed and fortunate to be able to have my mother come from Caracas. Her support, guidance and energy have been crucial on this 'complicated' process. She is still living -and sleeping- with me in Madrid.

- The process is long, slow and expensive... and she was right! I'm not yet able to retake my usual pace of work and the negative financial impact is extremely high.

- Avoid stress and anxiety. Every Time I learn to liberate myself more, to put less weight on my shoulders, to vent. I have learned that, even if for now it means I have to rely on medicines to make it possible, I do.

- Stay positive. I can't be any other way. Even though there are natural low moments, I'm now aware this new syndrome has a cure, I have found the right doctor, I have affective and emotional support from friends and family and, thanks to the angels on my way, this road has been more manageable and I am ready for recovery.


What Art for Health is for



Treatment for fibromyalgia is expensive, that is the undeniable truth.  I have been lucky enough to find ways to fund my treatment, but it has been at the cost of  a very scary word, particularly for someone who is currently unable to work: Debt.

Fortunately, I'm now starting to feel myself again, I can finally sleep and therefore, think and create: it is time to get hands-on!  I still have months of upcomming appointments, medicines and physical therapy to rehabilitate my muscles almost atrophied because of the counter-indicated complete rest initial treatment.

Don't stop and don't look back: my steps are forward, I'll end up stronger and healthier after this!

I'd like to invite you to be a part of my happy way out of this condition and of the decision I made months ago, and keep on telling myself every day: "This is the beginning of my healthy life, I will be healthy for the many upcoming years I will live".


How you can help

You may be asking yourselves why I’m sharing this now or how you can be part of this project… in many ways:

- With your affection, which I will always be grateful for.

- Helping me pay my debts ( €10,000 until now) and continue with what is left of my treatment  withouth entering into another debt again -which will also help eliminate additional stress that only makes my condition stronger.

- By being multiplying agents of my campaign and leveraging the power of a great ripple effect.

- By helping others learn about Fibromyalgia and understand the particularities of this condition in order to give diagnosed -or undiagnosed- patients the hope of having a way out.




Perks of supporting our case

You’ll get rewards on exchange! I'll give you what I love most and what I'm best at: photographs!.

Depending on the contribution you make you will have the opportunity of choosing a photo from an unpublished series called LIFE that my eye captured 4 years ago. I was saving it for the right moment, and the right moment has arrive

The size of the photograph will be related to the amount of your donation, and it will be sent digitally to avoid costs of printing and mailing. You will also receive all the information of the selected photo, my credits and, if you wish, a dedicated postcard.

Enter here to go directly to the gallery: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/art-for-health#gallery


The reach: beyond helping me

The objective of the campaign goes far beyond helping me fund and complete the treatment required for my recovery.

A percentage of your contribution will be destined to continue to collaborate with  the non-profit foundation  Fundación Internacional del Dolor , registered in the Spanish Ministry of Education and Culture in 1997  (registry number: Madrid 1-3-502),  focused on investigating and raising awareness around pain related conditions.

Another percentage will be given to a special person who took care of me with so much love, who stayed with me, always aware of my needs before my mother could be with me and who has kept on helping us after my mom came. Chain of favors? Kind of...

I will keep on doing everything I can to recover: I have already added exercise to my daily routine, and I will give everything I have within me to continue to get better, and continue enjoying LIFE, because hey, I enjoy myself too! My spirit, my passions and my incessant attitude of expressing everything I come up with.


Versión en castellano



Mi "no tan breve" historia de salud

A los 14 años fui diagnosticada con artritis reumatoide y desde entonces descubrí lo que era vivir con dolor. Mi A.R. entró en remisión por primera vez hace unos 10 años y hoy, salvo por los inconfundibles signos que llevo en mi cuerpo, que me individualizan y caracterizan, la artritis es para mi casi inexistente en síntomas.

Hace más de año y medio comencé a sentir dolor otra vez, uno distinto, permanente, muscular. Meses de visitas a médicos de la salud pública sin tener idea de razones; ﬁsioterapias, pruebas, un 'puede ser consecuencia de tantas horas sentada trabajando' y el dolor en aumento.

Dada de baja tras acabar en urgencias el 24 de febrero con un dolor que no me dejaba ni respirar, ﬁnalmente el 20 de marzo después de recoger a mi mamá al aeropuerto, dejar sus maletas en casa e irnos al médico, el temido diagnóstico fue develado: Fibromialgia. Había escuchado hablar de ella, pero realmente no tenía ni idea. Intenté partir de las bases de mi experiencia con la artritis atacando la nueva realidad a tiempo para no darle más campo, pero lamentablemente la respuesta de la seguridad social fue lenta y con grandes desaciertos. Sin yo saberlo el síndrome se había incubado.

Supe de una doctora que asegura que la condición tiene cura, y no lo pongo en duda, pero las consultas son costosas y no las cubre ningún seguro. Ni lo pensé: conocer la positiva experiencia de una chica que había pasado por lo mismo fue mi principal motivación. Así que el 8 de abril tuve mi primera cita y desde ese día hasta hoy he evolucionado favorablemente.


Lo que significa vivir con fibromialgia

Desde esa primera cita, las advertencias y recomendaciones médicas fueron muy claras:

- Es importante que estés siempre acompañada. Afortunadamente mi mamá pudo viajar desde Caracas, su apoyo, su guía y su empuje han sido claves en este proceso un tanto 'complicado'. Ella sigue viviendo -y durmiendo- conmigo en Madrid.

- El proceso es largo, lento y costoso, ¡y tenían razón! Aún no estoy en capacidad de retomar mi ritmo habitual de trabajo y el impacto económico ha sido muy elevado.

- Evita el estrés y la ansiedad. Voy aprendiendo a liberarme cada vez más, a cargarme menos, a desahogarme, aunque signifique, por ahora, recurrir a medicamentos que me faciliten el proceso.

- Mantente positiva. No puedo ser de otra manera. A pesar de los momentos naturales de bajón, tengo en cuenta que la condición tiene cura, que he dado con el médico indicado, y que cuento con el apoyo de amigos y familiares.


¿De qué se trata Art for Health?

Es una campaña que busca recaudar fondos a través de una serie inédita de fotografías realizadas en 2010. Lo costoso del tratamiento es una realidad, aunque no imaginaba hasta qué punto. He contado con la suerte de haber tenido de dónde sacar dinero hasta ahora, pero eso ha signiﬁcado una palabra temida: deudas.

Llegó el momento de poner manos a la obra, de volver a crear. Yo no me quedo quieta ni miro hacia atrás, todos mis pasos son hacia adelante, ¡de esto saldré fortalecida!

Gracias al ejército de ángeles en mi camino esto se ha hecho más llevadero a todo nivel, pero aún faltan meses de citas, rehabilitación y fortalecimiento del sistema muscular, casi atroﬁado por el reposo inicial, contraindicado para la fibromialgia.

Sin embargo,  además de las deudas adquiridas, hará falta más dinero para esta etapa de tratamiento y recuperación...  Es aquí donde vuestro aporte comienza a ser pieza fundamental en mi proceso de recuperación.


¿Cómo puedes ayudar?

Ahora os debéis estar preguntando porqué estoy compartiendo ahora cómo podéis ser parte de este proyecto… De muchas formas:

- Con vuestro afecto, del cual siempre estaré agradecida.

- Ayudándome a pagar mis deudas (€ 10.000 hasta ahora) y continuar con el resto de mi tratamiento sin endeudarme de nuevo - cosa que además ayuda a eliminar el estrés que solo hace empeorar mi condición.

- Siendo agentes multiplicadores de mi campaña y hacer que se cree una reacción en cadena.

- Ayudando a otros a informarse sobre la fibromialgia y que entiendan las particularidades de la condición, dándole a los diagnosticados - o no diagnosticados - la esperanza de que existe una salida.


Lo que consigues al apoyar esta campaña

¡Obtienes premios a cambio! Daré lo que más me gusta y lo que sé hacer mejor: ¡fotos!

Dependiendo de tu contribución tendrás la oportunidad de elegir entre las imágenes de una serie inédita llamada LIFE que mi ojo capturó hace 4 años. La tenía reservada para algún momento importante y ese momento ha llegado.  El tamaño de la imagen varía de acuerdo al aporte realizado, y en la mayor parte su entrega será en formato digital para evitar costos de impresión y envío postal. Con cada una recibirás también la información de la fotografía seleccionada, un certificado con los créditos de autoría y, si lo deseas, una postal imprimible dedicada.

Entra aquí para ver la galería: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/art-for-health#gallery


El alcance de la campaña según el aporte

Con tu aporte conseguirás ayudarme a conseguir una completa recuperación, permitiéndome cumplir con los pasos necesarios dar continuidad a mi tratamiento,

Un porcentaje de tu contribución está dedicado a continuar  la colaboración directa con la fundación sin fines de lucro Fundación Internacional del Dolor,  registrada ante el Ministerio de Educación y Cultura de España en 1997 (número de registro: Madrid 1-3-502)  y dedicada a investigar y difundir información acerca de condiciones de dolor.

Otro porcentaje le será entregado a una persona que, durante los primeros meses de mi condición, antes de la llegada de mi mamá, se hizo cargo de mí y me ayudó a sobrellevar el dolor… una especie de “cadena de retribución”.

La posible creación de un programa/fundación donde el arte sea fundamental en cualquier terapia destinada a restablecer la salud y la felicidad frente a cualquier condición.

Por mi parte, me comprometo a hacer todo lo que esté a mi alcance para lograr una completa recuperación que me permita seguir mejorando y disfrutando de la vida durante los muchos años que me quedan por vivir… mi espíritu, mis pasiones y mi necesidad incesante de expresión estarán siempre agradecidos.

Perks of supporting our case
You’ll get rewards on exchange! I'll give you what I love most and what I'm best at: photographs!.
Depending on the contribution you make you will have the opportunity of choosing a photo from an unpublished series called LIFE that my eye captured 4 years ago. I was saving it for the right moment, and the right moment has arrive 
The size of the photograph will be related to the amount of your donation, and it will be sent digitally to avoid costs of printing and mailing. You will also receive all the information of the selected photo, my credits and, if you wish, a dedicated postcard.
Enter here to go directly to the gallery: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/art-for-health#gallery



The reach: beyond helping me
The objective of the campaign goes far beyond helping me fund and complete the treatment required for my recovery. 
A percentage of your contribution will be destined to continue to collaborate with  the non-profit foundation  Fundación Internacional del Dolor , registered in the Spanish Ministry of Education and Culture in 1997  (registry number: Madrid 1-3-502),  focused on investigating and raising awareness around pain related conditions. 
Another percentage will be given to a special person who took care of me with so much love, who stayed with me, always aware of my needs before my mother could be with me and who has kept on helping us after my mom came. Chain of favors? Kind of...
I will keep on doing everything I can to recover: I have already added exercise to my daily routine, and I will give everything I have within me to continue to get better, and continue enjoying LIFE, because hey, I enjoy myself too! My spirit, my passions and my incessant attitude of expressing everything I come up with.


Versión en castellano







Mi "no tan breve" historia de saludA los 14 años fui diagnosticada con artritis reumatoide y desde entonces descubrí lo que era vivir con dolor. Mi A.R. entró en remisión por primera vez hace unos 10 años y hoy, salvo por los inconfundibles signos que llevo en mi cuerpo, que me individualizan y caracterizan, la artritis es para mi casi inexistente en síntomas.Hace más de año y medio comencé a sentir dolor otra vez, uno distinto, permanente, muscular. Meses de visitas a médicos de la salud pública sin tener idea de razones; ﬁsioterapias, pruebas, un 'puede ser consecuencia de tantas horas sentada trabajando' y el dolor en aumento. Dada de baja tras acabar en urgencias el 24 de febrero con un dolor que no me dejaba ni respirar, ﬁnalmente el 20 de marzo después de recoger a mi mamá al aeropuerto, dejar sus maletas en casa e irnos al médico, el temido diagnóstico fue develado: Fibromialgia. Había escuchado hablar de ella, pero realmente no tenía ni idea. Intenté partir de las bases de mi experiencia con la artritis atacando la nueva realidad a tiempo para no darle más campo, pero lamentablemente la respuesta de la seguridad social fue lenta y con grandes desaciertos. Sin yo saberlo el síndrome se había incubado. Supe de una doctora que asegura que la condición tiene cura, y no lo pongo en duda, pero las consultas son costosas y no las cubre ningún seguro. Ni lo pensé: conocer la positiva experiencia de una chica que había pasado por lo mismo fue mi principal motivación. Así que el 8 de abril tuve mi primera cita y desde ese día hasta hoy he evolucionado favorablemente. 

Lo que significa vivir con fibromialgia
Desde esa primera cita, las advertencias y recomendaciones médicas fueron muy claras:
- Es importante que estés siempre acompañada. Afortunadamente mi mamá pudo viajar desde Caracas, su apoyo, su guía y su empuje han sido claves en este proceso un tanto 'complicado'. Ella sigue viviendo -y durmiendo- conmigo en Madrid.
- El proceso es largo, lento y costoso, ¡y tenían razón! Aún no estoy en capacidad de retomar mi ritmo habitual de trabajo y el impacto económico ha sido muy elevado.
- Evita el estrés y la ansiedad. Voy aprendiendo a liberarme cada vez más, a cargarme menos, a desahogarme, aunque signifique, por ahora, recurrir a medicamentos que me faciliten el proceso. 
- Mantente positiva. No puedo ser de otra manera. A pesar de los momentos naturales de bajón, tengo en cuenta que la condición tiene cura, que he dado con el médico indicado, y que cuento con el apoyo de amigos y familiares.







¿De qué se trata Art for Health?


Es una campaña que busca recaudar fondos a través de una serie inédita de fotografías realizadas en 2010. Lo costoso del tratamiento es una realidad, aunque no imaginaba hasta qué punto. He contado con la suerte de haber tenido de dónde sacar dinero hasta ahora, pero eso ha signiﬁcado una palabra temida: deudas. 
Llegó el momento de poner manos a la obra, de volver a crear. Yo no me quedo quieta ni miro hacia atrás, todos mis pasos son hacia adelante, ¡de esto saldré fortalecida!
Gracias al ejército de ángeles en mi camino esto se ha hecho más llevadero a todo nivel, pero aún faltan meses de citas, rehabilitación y fortalecimiento del sistema muscular, casi atroﬁado por el reposo inicial, contraindicado para la fibromialgia. 
Sin embargo,  además de las deudas adquiridas, hará falta más dinero para esta etapa de tratamiento y recuperación...  Es aquí donde vuestro aporte comienza a ser pieza fundamental en mi proceso de recuperación.




¿Cómo puedes ayudar?

Ahora os debéis estar preguntando porqué estoy compartiendo ahora cómo podéis ser parte de este proyecto… De muchas formas:
- Con vuestro afecto, del cual siempre estaré agradecida.
- Ayudándome a pagar mis deudas (€ 10.000 hasta ahora) y continuar con el resto de mi tratamiento sin endeudarme de nuevo - cosa que además ayuda a eliminar el estrés que solo hace empeorar mi condición. 
- Siendo agentes multiplicadores de mi campaña y hacer que se cree una reacción en cadena.
- Ayudando a otros a informarse sobre la fibromialgia y que entiendan las particularidades de la condición, dándole a los diagnosticados - o no diagnosticados - la esperanza de que existe una salida. 






Lo que consigues al apoyar esta campaña¡Obtienes premios a cambio! Daré lo que más me gusta y lo que sé hacer mejor: ¡fotos!
 Dependiendo de tu contribución tendrás la oportunidad de elegir entre las imágenes de una serie inédita llamada LIFE que mi ojo capturó hace 4 años. La tenía reservada para algún momento importante y ese momento ha llegado.  El tamaño de la imagen varía de acuerdo al aporte realizado, y en la mayor parte su entrega será en formato digital para evitar costos de impresión y envío postal. Con cada una recibirás también la información de la fotografía seleccionada, un certificado con los créditos de autoría y, si lo deseas, una postal imprimible dedicada. 
Entra aquí para ver la galería: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/art-for-health#gallery


El alcance de la campaña según el aporteCon tu aporte conseguirás ayudarme a conseguir una completa recuperación, permitiéndome cumplir con los pasos necesarios dar continuidad a mi tratamiento, Un porcentaje de tu contribución está dedicado a continuar  la colaboración directa con la fundación sin fines de lucro Fundación Internacional del Dolor,  registrada ante el Ministerio de Educación y Cultura de España en 1997 (número de registro: Madrid 1-3-502)  y dedicada a investigar y difundir información acerca de condiciones de dolor.Otro porcentaje le será entregado a una persona que, durante los primeros meses de mi condición, antes de la llegada de mi mamá, se hizo cargo de mí y me ayudó a sobrellevar el dolor… una especie de “cadena de retribución”. La posible creación de un programa/fundación donde el arte sea fundamental en cualquier terapia destinada a restablecer la salud y la felicidad frente a cualquier condición. Por mi parte, me comprometo a hacer todo lo que esté a mi alcance para lograr una completa recuperación que me permita seguir mejorando y disfrutando de la vida durante los muchos años que me quedan por vivir… mi espíritu, mis pasiones y mi necesidad incesante de expresión estarán siempre agradecidos.

story:
Hi Everyone!

My name is Yasmina El Sayed, and I am 18 years old. From an early age, it has always been my absolute dream to become a professional tennis player. Due to having played the sport since I was 7, my passion has already been rewarded; some of my best achievements include winning county, national and international tournaments. 

I currently train 35 hours a week, 20 hours technical tennis  on court as well as 10 hours of tactical & 5 hours fitness and conditioning. I have recently attained my A-levels, as I have always believed that maintaining a high level of education is a fundamental pre-requisite to becoming an elite professional athlete.

In order for me to achieve my goal, I must first get a world ranking; this requires me to travel to different countries around the world in order to participate in ITF (International Tennis Federation) events.

I have worked really hard and I am only one WIN away from getting a world ranking to start my professional career.

I now have this great opportunity to get my world ranking but to cover my travelling, accommodation and tournament costs I need to raise £1,200 to get me to Egypt to play 4 ITF’s that start on the 6th of April 

I am asking for your help because unfortunately I can’t afford these costs due to financial difficulties. I will be forever grateful and thankful to the people who can help me achieve my life-long ambition. Please join me on this journey; that of an ordinary girl desperate to achieve an extraordinary dream.
